translation: There are many great things about Idaho. There are great views, great fishing, and potatoes (actually the "famous potatoes"). Why do some groups of citizens believe that it is their right to hunt an animal just because they live in an area where it can be found? This is the root of the problem. No, you have no such right. The United Nations has restarted its process for setting rules on "responsible state behaviour in cyberspace" with two separate forums, and Australia intends to continue being a key player.
On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs Dr Tobias Feakin
continuation: attended an initial ministerial - level conference on the subject at the office of the UN ' s " Third Committee " in New York . It ' s the same body responsible for set human rights standards .A separate conference , co - hosted by the Global Commission on the Stability of Cyberspace and with Feakin ' s involvement , was held on the same day . The New York Times reported in May the Third Committee , which includes all 193 members of the General Assembly , would continue discussions " to examine " the feasibility of updating laws of responsible state behaviour in cyberspace .The UN has been struggling to come up with a working definition of state - sponsored cyber - attacks ever since the Stuxnet computer virus was discovered five years previously . As RT reported at the time , the virus is suspected to be one of a string of stealth attacks on Iran ' s nuclear power facilities in
translation:
The United Nations has restarted the process to set rules for the "responsible conduct of states in cyberspace" through two separate forums, and Australia will continue to play a key role.
On Friday, Australia's ambassador for cyber security, Dr Tobias Feakin, attended the first ministerial meeting on the issue at the United Nations Third Committee Office in New York. This is the same body responsible for setting human rights standards. On the same day, another conference was held, hosted by the World Commission on the Stability of Cyberspace and attended by Fikin. The New York Times reported in May that the General Assembly's Third Committee, which includes all 193 members, would continue discussions to "explore" the possibility of updating the Act on Responsible Conduct of States in Cyberspace. Since the discovery of the Stuxnet computer virus five years ago, a working definition of a state-sponsored cyberattack has been established. As RT reported at the time, the virus is believed to be one of a series of covert attacks on Iranian nuclear power facilities.

Following the Australian government citing a lack of separation of edge and core in 5G, Huawei has demonstrated what it says is full isolation of each network component in New Zealand on a trial network with Spark.
Huawei has revealed a 5G trial network
continuation: in New Zealand that the telco claims provides complete separation of its core and edge network , with no backhaul involved . The trial , undertaken with Spark , has been designed to mirror what it calls a real - world commercial network and is focused on providing core , edge , and enterprise systems .What youre looking at in the installation of the edge unit is the full spectrum of what is required for 5G , Spark CTO Brad Whitlock added . Youre able to connect out to the telco core .You have services being provided into that core network . Youve got what is effectively what we are calling overlay applications , or those services that require to be provided directly to the edge on the device to make sure it works with the core .The trial itself utilizes a transparent core network which offers SDN functionality at the core , and ran through to the edge and service nodes , which
translation:
After the Australian government cited a lack of edge-core separation in 5G, Huawei demonstrated in a test network using Spark that it claimed to have fully isolated all network components in New Zealand.
Huawei has unveiled a 5G test network in New Zealand, which the carrier says can completely separate core and edge networks without the need for backhaul. This test, conducted using Spark, is designed to reflect what we would call a real-world commercial network, with a focus on delivering core, edge, and enterprise systems. Spark CTO Brad Whitlock added that when installing edge devices, you will be considering the full spectrum needed for 5G. You can connect to your telecommunications company's backbone line. This core network provides services. There are basically what are called overlay applications, services that need to be provided directly at the edge of the device to work reliably with the core. The trial itself uses a transparent core network that brings SDN functionality to the core and migrates to the edge and service nodes.

input: Just when you think AMC has reached maximum saturation of zombie programming, they announce there will be another Walking Dead spin-off  this time set on a plane. Yes, thats right, Zombies on a Plane (there has been no confirmation
continuation: on what the official title is yet ) . The Zombies on a Plane episode will air as part of an epic three - hour event , comprised of both of the season sevens finales for The Walking Dead and Fear the Walking Dead .This special will air Sunday , October 15 at 8pm on AMC . In terms of plot , it will probably follow the dead coming back to life on a plane , much like what was seen in the trailer for season seven of The Walking Dead .There have been numerous attempts to bring the Walking Dead series to a new platform . The biggest was the multiplayer video title that debuted this past November for Xbox One , Playstation 4 and PC .That title was so poorly received that it got an F from reviewers and gamers . The game is also in development for the Nintendo Switch , but there is no word on when it will launch
translation: Just when you thought AMC had reached saturation point with zombie shows, they announced that a Walking Dead spinoff, this time set on an airplane, would be in the works. Yes, that's right, Zombies on a Plane (official title not yet confirmed). The episode "Zombies on a Plane" will air as part of an epic three-hour event consisting of The Walking Dead and Fear the Walking Dead Season 7 finale. The special will air on AMC on Sunday, October 15th at 8pm. Plot-wise, it's likely to involve the dead being brought back to life on a plane, similar to what was shown in The Walking Dead Season 7 trailer. There have been many attempts to bring The Walking Dead series to new platforms. . The most popular was the multiplayer video, which was released for Xbox One, Playstation 4, and PC last November. It was so poorly received that it received an F rating from reviewers and gamers. The game is also in development for Nintendo Switch, but it's unclear when it will be released.

input: World Sake Day or "Nihonshu no Hi" is a significant day on the Japanese calendar with celebrations held annually on 1 October. This date is considered "New Year's Day" for sake because it marks the first day of the sake
continuation: - making season . As is the case with many holidays , there are a number of legendary and historical events linked with the origin of this vacation , the most significant one being associated with the founding of the Kuroda - style Gekkeikan sake brewery in 1637 .This tale is depicted on a sign at the brewery today and can be viewed in the image above . Although the beginnings of the festival are murky , one major element that can be attributed to Nihonshu no Hi is the appreciation of the alleged advantages of a small amount of alcohol , particularly sake , to one ' s health .The holiday evolved at a time when Western ideas about Japan ' s drank traditions began to enter the mainstream of Japanese thinking . A 7-day plan to prepare your home and garden for summer.

translation:
Former India captain and women's team coach Divya Singh is impressed with the talent displayed by 18 of India's top female prospects currently training under the Basketball Development Programme.
Nagpur: Former Indian captain and women's team coach Divya Singh is impressed with the talent displayed by the country's 18 top female prospects who are being trained under her basketball development programme. Top female players will undergo specialized training at the High Performance Training Center (HPTC) at the GIS Sports Complex in Gadshiroli under the guidance of FIBA and NBA certified professional coach Andrew Stewart. Australia's entertainment industry was in mourning today for former Crowded House drummer Paul Hester who hanged himself in a Melbourne park.
The 46-year-old father-of-two was found dead at Elsternwick Park in Brighton on Saturday
continuation: morning . A post - mortem will be performed today to identify the cause of death but police sources say there were no suspicious conditions .Mr Hester had battled depression for decades and was in a number of therapy facilities in the previous few years . His bandmates were among those who displayed shock and grief on Monday .We are all astonished and shocked by this tragedy , Neil Finn said in a statement . It is a tragedy not just for those who knew Paul but for all who loved him .Paul had battled depression but he had given up drinking and was beginning to live a calmer more settled existence . AAP confirmed that former Prime Minister Julia Gillard said she talked to Mr Hester and his wife Kristy Saggers last month , after Hester was involved in a bicycle crash that caused him with major head injuries .
translation:
Australia's entertainment industry is today mourning the death of former Crowded House drummer Paul Hester, who hanged himself in a Melbourne park.
The 46-year-old father-of-two was found dead in Brighton's Elsternwick Park on Saturday morning. An autopsy will be performed today to determine the cause of death, but police officials said no suspicious symptoms were found. Hester has battled depression for decades and has been in and out of numerous treatment facilities in recent years. Among those expressing shock and sadness on Monday were his bandmates. Neil Finn said in a statement: "We are all stunned and shocked by this tragedy." This is a tragedy not only for those who knew Paul, but for all who loved him. Although Paul suffered from depression, he stopped drinking and began to live a calmer, calmer life. AAP confirmed that former Prime Minister Julia Gillard said she spoke to Hester and his wife Christie Saggers last month, after Hester suffered serious head injuries in a bicycle accident.

input: You remember the tragic story about the murder of Chauncey Bailey, the editor of a weekly newspaper in Oakland, Calif., killed on Aug. 2 as he was walking to work. Police quickly made arrests following the slaying, which they think was
continuation: motivated by what the victims were writing and publishing about Your Black Muslim Bakery , whose leader is Yusuf Bey IV , the son of the bakery ' s longtime founder . Bey IV has been in jail since his arrest .At a Friday preliminary hearing , Judge William I . Henderson bound over his two alleged accomplices for trial . The first was Devaughndre Broussard , 21 , whose court appearance came just a day after his 20th birthday , on Sept . 19 .The second was Antoine Mackey , 32 , who is in a mental hospital . Bailey , there was no way they were going to getting away with murder , " explained Judge William I .
translation: You may remember the tragic story of Chauncey Bailey, a weekly newspaper editor who was murdered on his way to work in Oakland, California, on August 2nd. Police made arrests soon after the killings, but believed the motive was that the victims had written and posted about the Muslim bakery Your Black, whose leader was the longtime son of the bakery's founder. It was Yusuf Bey IV. Bey IV has been in jail since his arrest. At a preliminary hearing Friday, Judge William I. Henderson tried the two alleged accomplices. The first, 21-year-old Devondre Broussard, appeared in court on September 1, the day after his 20th birthday. 19. The second person is Antoine MacKay, 32, who is in a psychiatric hospital. In my opinion, the court gave a very insightful view of the atrocities and other crimes of Bey IV and his associates. ``There was no point in killing Mr. Bailey. There was no way they could get away with murder,'' Judge William I explained.

Singing The Seekers hit I am, you are, we are Australian, the protesters first rallied at a crowd
continuation: of 500 people on the lawn of Dutton ' s office . Then they marched on Dutton ' s office in nearby Albert Street .They then staged a sitting - in outside the building . Supporters say the parents facing deportation because the husbands are refugees and the women married them before a change in the law in 2006 .Sources within Immigration Department say that while 48 , 000 other people would not be deported , it is not certain what happens to the 10 , 000 persons who face deportation because they breaks the rules of the previous regime .
translation:
Friends and supporters of a Tamil family facing deportation marched in the rain to Peter Dutton's office in Brisbane.
Singing The Seekers' hit song ``I am, you are, we are a Australia'', demonstrators first gathered in front of a crowd of 500 people on the lawn outside Mr Dutton's office. They then marched to Dutton's office on nearby Albert Street. They then staged a sit-in outside the building. Supporters say their parents are at risk of deportation because their husbands are refugees and the women married before the 2006 law change. An additional 48,000 people will not be deported, but it is unclear what will happen to them, immigration officials said. Ten thousand people face deportation for violating the previous government's rules.

input: It's 75 years since Trotsky, already expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, went to start a new life in Mexico. But he was hunted down in Mexico City by Stalinist assassins, as his grandson, who was living with him when he
continuation: was murdered , recalls . My father arrived into the world in the midst of the Russian Revolution .I was born in a region exiled from his motherland . That nation was Mexico .On September 11 , 1940 , my grandparents , the former commander - in - chief of the Soviet Red Army , was assassinated in his bathroom at his home in Mexico City . translation: Seventy-five years have passed since Trotsky, who had already been expelled from the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and went into exile, started a new life in Mexico. But he was cornered by Stalinist assassins in Mexico City, according to his grandson, who was living with him when he was killed. My father was born at the height of the Russian Revolution. I was born in a region where I was forced to flee my homeland. This country was Mexico. On September 11, 1940, my grandparents, former commanders-in-chief of the Soviet Red Army, were murdered in the bathtub of their Mexico City home. My grandfather Leon Trotsky was born in the city of Yanovka in southern Russia, about 400 miles south of Moscow. His father was a religious scholar and his mother a teacher. They raised seven children. Trotsky's father died when his uncle was still young, and Trotsky began farming in southern Russia and became a successful agronomist. My grandfather married Alexandra Sokolovskaya in 1900.

translation:

translation:
A Dayton jury found a state deputy not guilty of assault on Tuesday.
DAYTON, Tenn. (WRCB)  A Dayton jury found a state deputy not guilty of assault on Tuesday.
The assault trial of state Rep. Jim Cobb began Tuesday morning in Rhea County Court. Cobb was accused of assaulting his sons ex-girlfriend at their Dayton home in June 2008. Cobb and his wife, Nora, were arrested and charged after Dayton police detectives investigated the alleged assault at their home. Cobb was arrested on a simple assault charge, and his wife was arrested on a public misconduct charge for failing to report the incident to police. Cobb pleaded not guilty, as did Nora Cobb. At the time, state Rep. Jim Cobb denied ever hitting his grandsons ex-girlfriend, saying he hadnt been informed of what she had said to him. He did, however, admit that he had lost his temper while hospitalized and had yelled abuse at the woman. His home. Dayton authorities said the couple claimed the woman had filed suit.

translation: When I write about last year, the first thing that strikes me is that it was a year of free money. Almost everyone in the middle class seemed to have money to spend. Often it was a debt, but no one objected. In fact, an incredibly optimistic atmosphere prevailed, to the point where consumers went into debt out of sheer love for this business. There was a belief that things would get better in the new year, and as a result, they would look better too. I'm looking forward to it with all my might. However, it is unclear whether these feelings will last forever. The biggest concern is the level of debt. Analysts at State Bank of India reported that there are pressing challenges in retail banking, and that may not be far from the truth. The list of creditors' complaints also includes deficiencies in provisions regarding penalty interest rates on consumer loans. Agreement. That's not the only concern for lenders. The city's civil court recently heard a case in which a consumer refused to pay a credit card bill.

Great Britain have finished outside the medals at the World Wheelchair Rugby Championships in Canada.
However, their sixth-placed finish sees GB, who were ranked ninth in the world before the tournament, move three places up the world rankings.
Captain Steve
continuation: Bell , 23 , and Australia beat Canada 45 - 41 in the final , with the Canucks winning gold four years ago in Adelaide . The best five nations in the world had all qualified for Rio in August .GB are ranked ninth , with reigning world hosts the Netherlands third , Australia fifth and Great Britain ' s closest rivals the United States seventh . GB team captain Steve Bell , who plays for Sheffield Steelers in the GB Wheelchair Rugby League team , said : " The squad did really well , even though we didn ' t attain the objective we setting ourselves , of getting into the medals . "
translation:
Great Britain finished without a medal at the Wheelchair Rugby World Cup in Canada.
However, Great Britain, who was ranked 9th in the world before the tournament, finished in 6th place, moving up three places in the world rankings.
When the Canucks won gold in Adelaide four years ago, captain Steve Bell, 23, and the Australians defeated Canada 45-41 in the final. The top five countries in the world all qualified for Rio in August. The UK is in 9th place, the Netherlands in 3rd place, Australia in 3rd place, Australia in 5th place and the UK's closest rival, the United States, in 7th place. Team GB captain Steve Bell, who plays for the British wheelchair rugby league team Sheffield Steelers, said: ``Although we didn't achieve our goal of winning a medal, the team did a great job.''

input:
No official date exists to mark when valuable holdouts become critical to a team's hopes, but you can figure any player not signed by this weekend has become a major problem.
The two biggest holdouts of the season are Green Bay quarterback Don Maj
continuation: kowski and New England ' s defensive lineman William Henderson . The Packers officially have about a million dollar offer to Majkowski , who is one of three players who can still be compensated under the old salary cap .He ' ll getting a far better deal if he waits until after March 1 , but he ' ll be in limbo , making only the minimum of $ 110 , 000 if he doesn ' t sign soon . Both sides are showing they expect a agreement to be reached .Henderson isn ' t close to a deal , and if he doesn ' t sign by the weekend , the Patriots are heading to be in a huge bind . They only have about $ 1 . 7 million to spend under the cap , and only six players are under contract , so Henderson ' s 11 percent share of the salary cap comes at a critical time .Other teams have problems of their own .
translation:
There is no official date as to when the prized holdout will become important to the team's hopes, but the players not signed this weekend are thought to be a major concern.
His biggest opponents this season are Green Bay defensive end Don Mazikowski and New England defensive lineman William Henderson. The Packers have officially offered Mazikowski nearly $1 million, and he is one of three players who can still receive compensation under the old salary cap. He could get a better contract if he waits until March 1st, but if he doesn't sign soon, he won't be able to get the $110,000 minimum. Both sides have indicated they hope to reach an agreement. Henderson is still not close to a contract, and the Patriots will be in a tough situation if he doesn't sign by the end of the week. They only have about $1. With $7 million to spend on the cap and only six players under contract, Henderson's 11 percent cap hit rate comes at a critical time. Other teams are also having their own problems.

input:
David Wu, a Qualcomm engineer, fell to his death from the sixth floor of Qualcomms AY building at its headquarters complex Sunday. The death was originally reported by Chinese media.
Similar Qualcomm suicides took place in 2010 and 2012. Because
continuation: Wu is a Qualcomm worker , its likely he worked on radio - related Qualcomm software . Wu , 42 , had been with the company since 2012 , after having previously worked as a mobile software engineer at Mozilla .His LinkedIn site records his previous work experience at Motorola . There is no information available at this time regarding the conditions of Wus death .
translation:
David Wu, a Qualcomm engineer, died Sunday after falling from the sixth floor of the Qualcomm AY building at the company's headquarters. The death was initially reported by Chinese media.
Similar suicides occurred at Qualcomm in 2010 and 2012. Mr. Wu is a Qualcomm employee, so he likely worked on Qualcomm's wireless software. Mr. Wu, 42, has been with the company since 2012 and previously worked at Mozilla as a mobile software engineer. His LinkedIn site documents his previous experience at Motorola. At this time, there is no information regarding the circumstances of Mr. Wu's death.

input: Twenty five years later, I met a student who was frustrated and disappointed about his life. I asked him the simple question, why? Then he began to express himself about what he wanted to achieve in his life. I was very impressed with his ambitions
continuation: but was distressed about his lack of ability to reach his dreams . I questioned him if he had a vision statement of his life .I shared my own vision statement with him . He said it was not possible for him to write one .It sounded too boring and too difficult . At this time in my life , I was writing book after book .I shared with him that it had been like that for me also , until I finding the magic word that sparked my vision . Once I started wrote my vision statement , it flowed naturally from my soul .I found it easy to express what was vital to me , how I wanted to spend my time , and what I wanted to achieve with my life . My vision statement for my career and my personal life was : I see myself as a highly respected and appreciated professional who is an authority and specialist in my field .I am the writer and lecturer in the field of the management
translation: 25 years later, I met a student who was upset and disappointed in his life. I asked him a simple question. "Why?" Then he started talking about what he wanted to achieve in his life. I was very impressed with his ambition, but angry that he couldn't achieve his dreams. I asked him if he had a vision for his life. I shared my vision with him. He said he couldn't write a book. It sounded too boring and too complicated. During this period of my life, I wrote one book after another. I told him that the same thing happened to me until I found the magic words that woke up my vision. Once I started writing my vision statement, it naturally flowed from my soul. It has become easier for me to express what is important to me, how I want to spend my time, and what I want to achieve in life. My vision for my career and personal life is: I consider myself an authority and expert in my field, and a highly respected and valued professional. I am a writer and lecturer in the field of business administration.

input:
DEFIANT Alan Shearer has urged his relegation-haunted Newcastle side to keep the faith.
With just one point from three games since he returned to St Jamess Park, the Geordie icon has been unable to work an

Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger was briefed and held a Press Conference on the Canyon Fire and other Los Angeles area fires. Other fires in the
continuation: San Diego area are spreading . The President issued an Emergency Proclamation .On Tuesday October 23rd the President issued an Emergency Proclamation declaring that a major disaster exists in the State of California and authorized Federal assistance to supplement State , local , and tribal measures to save lives and to shield property . Wildfires have killed more than 415 , 000 acres and affect 500 building in Southern California .The worst of the fires is the Sawtooth Fire , which has burned nearly 166 , 000 acres in the San Bernardino National Forest and surrounding areas . The Sawtooth Fire is 20 percent contained .Wildfires have damaged more than 350 , 000 acres and kill more than 500 building in San Diego County , and have damaged 340 , 0
translation:
This is an update on the progress of efforts to quell out-of-control wildfires in Southern California.
Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger was briefed and held a press conference about the Canyon Fire and other fires in the Los Angeles area. Other fires are also spreading in the San Diego area. The president has declared a state of emergency. On Tuesday, October 23, the President declared a state of emergency, declaring a major disaster in California and authorizing federal assistance to supplement state, local, and tribal efforts to save lives and protect property. Wildfires have destroyed more than 415,000 acres in Southern California and affected 500 buildings. The worst of the fires was the Sawtooth Fire, which burned approximately 166,000 acres in the San Bernardino National Forest and surrounding areas. The fire is 20% contained. Wildfires have damaged more than 350,000 acres in San Diego County, destroyed more than 500 structures, and damaged 340,000 acres.

input: People and Us Weekly editors are in heaven: Both Jennifer Aniston and hubby Brad Pitt snagged Emmy noms Thursday. Aniston snagged a comedy best actress nod for having a baby on Friends; Pitt scored for a guest
continuation: appearance on his wifes thriller Dallas and a writing bid for writing and starring on Saturday Night Live . This will be the first time Pitt and Aniston will compete at the Emmys together since they married in July .
translation: The editors of People and Us Weekly are in heaven. On Thursday, Jennifer Aniston and her husband Brad Pitt were nominated for an Emmy Award. Aniston won Best Actress in a Comedy for her role in Friends. Pitt won for his wife's guest appearance in the thriller "Dallas" and for co-writing and starring in "Saturday Night Live." This will be Pitt and Aniston's first time together at the Emmy Awards since they got married in July.

input:
A British entrepreneur 'committed a deliberate fraud over a sustained period of time' to artificially inflate the value of his software company by billions of dollars ahead of its sale, the High Court has heard.
Hewlett-Packard (HP
continuation: ) , which bought the company , Autonomy for $ 11bn ( 6 . 5bn ) in 2011 , is suing for $ 5bn in damages , arguing that ex - CEO Mike Lynch and other trustees of Autonomy deliberately misled it over the health of the company . In 2014 , HP wrote off $ 5bn ( 2 . 9bn ) of the deal and launched its fraud inquiry .Autonomy ' s then - CEO , Mike Lynch , denied any wrongdoing and later criticized HP of an incompetent acquire . The dispute arose after HP acquired Autonomy in 2011 .But the tech corporation , which used to be part of Hewlett - Packard , said when it bought the firm it was not aware of a " shadowy consultancy group that had a say in Autonomy ' s accounting . "
translation:
A British entrepreneur "perpetrated a deliberate fraud over a prolonged period" by artificially inflating the value of his software company by billions of dollars before selling it, the High Court has heard.
Hewlett-Packard (HP), which acquired Autonomy in 2011 for $11 billion (approx. The company is suing for $5 billion in damages for misleading the company. In 2014, HP terminated the $5 billion ($2.9 billion) contract and launched an investigation into wrongdoing. Autonomy's then-CEO Mike Lynch denied any wrongdoing and later accused HP of making an incompetent acquisition. The controversy arose after HP acquired Autonomy in 2011. But the technology company, formerly part of Hewlett-Packard, said it was unaware of the existence of a "shadowy consulting group that had a say in Autonomy's accounting" when it acquired Autonomy. .

input:
The fight against Ottawas proposed tax changes for small corporations isnt over, even after watered-down policies were proposed in the latest federal budget following months of business community backlash.
The Coalition for Small Business Tax Fairness, a
continuation: group of business organizations , says the introduced modifications would still harm the countrys small businesses . The organization says its not only about higher taxes but also decreasing the already - low corporate taxation rate .It says the changes will push business owners to pull money out of their companies and instead invest in other securities or personal properties . However , it welcomes the governments move to remove certain types of passive revenue from the proposals , as well as changes that restrict the using of revenue sprinkling , which sees earnings among family groups to escape taxation .Despite the changes , business owners continue question whether tax planning might remain a thing of the past for little companies .
translation:
The fight against Ottawa's proposed tax changes for small businesses is far from over, even after months of backlash from the business community led to relief measures being proposed in the latest federal budget.
The Small Business Tax Fairness Coalition, a group of business organizations, says the changes will continue to have a negative impact on the nation's small businesses. In addition to raising taxes, the group says it aims to lower the already low corporate tax rate. He argues that the changes will encourage executives to take money out of their companies and invest it in other securities or personal assets instead. But he welcomed the government's decision to exclude some types of unearned income from the proposals, as well as changes that would limit the use of income sharing to avoid taxing income between family groups. Planning may be a thing of the past for small businesses.

The outrage , however , has become diluted .After only two weeks , it has become fewer about how to protect American children , and more about how to punish others in society . Focusing on the how is a form of cowardice that serves as an emotional and political cover for the failure to examine the deeper whythe structures of oppression , and the culture of in
translation:
This article was written by Valarie Kaul, a civil rights attorney, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nation's largest multifaith online community of organizers.
Shots were fired into the sanctuary of peace. The victims' families are calling for justice. And a wave of outrage and fear spread from rural America to a divided Senate. The school shooting in Parkland, Florida, which killed 17 people, has reignited heated debate about how to prevent it from happening again. Shortly afterward, victims and leaders, especially several Sikh Americans, spoke out against arming teachers. Some brave members of Congress are daring to speak out on the issue of background checks. But the anger subsided. In just two weeks, the question has become less about how to protect America's children and more about how to punish other members of society. Focuses on how a kind of meanness functions as an emotional and political cover for not examining the deeper causes of oppressive structures and cultures

Nuggets' Nikola Jokic (left) is defended by Celtics' Aaron Baynes during the first quarter at TD Garden in Boston on Monday.
Boston's Isiah Thomas got what he deserved, and the Nuggets won. Thomas scored 19 points in his first appearance at TD Garden since the Celtics sent him to the Lakers in August, but the Nuggets' 114-105 victory Monday night was pretty much the big picture. Monday marked the first time in a month that the Nuggets spent a full week together in training camp. Jokic and Malone trained together for the first time in nine months. Malone and Jokic were teammates in Spain last season before Jokic came to Denver in a four-team trade. input: Red Hat bought IT automation-centric configuration management DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, okay so we know that part. Retaining the Ansible brand and names as it does, this month sees Red Hat launch Ansible Container, but what is
continuation: this , you may ask ? Well , as weve written before , warehouses are a great way to broke up a complex IT environment , allowing containers to operate in isolation and gain control over the environment and help create it more agile , owing to their light weight and flexibility .Red Hat , as well as a number of other suppliers , have been building their own container ecosystems that also feel to simplify operations . Indeed , Google held its own kind of developer summit recently , where it announced some fresh tools , amongst them Kubernetes , which is a rivals to Docker .Red Hat said that containers are revolutionizing application development and implementation . With this acquisition , Red Hat will take Ansible Container to more platforms , and bring enterprise grade support , protection and scalability to containers , and help decrease the increasing burden of controlling hybrid cloud environments .Enterprises are increasingly shifting towards a DevOps model of infrastructure
translation: We know that part because Red Hat acquired Ansible, a company focused on automating IT configuration management suitable for DevOps. Keeping with the Ansible brand and name, Red Hat is releasing Ansible Container this month, but what is it?As I've written before, warehousing allows containers to operate in isolation and control the environment. It is a great way to partition a complex IT environment and make it more flexible due to its lightweight and flexibility. Red Hat and many other vendors have built their own container ecosystems, which are also designed to simplify operations. In fact, Google recently held something of a developer summit and announced some new tools, including his Kubernetes, a Docker competitor. Red Hat said containers are revolutionizing application development and deployment. With this acquisition, Red Hat will deploy its Ansible Container on more platforms, providing enterprise-grade support, security, and scalability for containers, and helping ease the growing burden of managing hybrid cloud environments. . Enterprises are moving towards his DevOps infrastructure model.

translation:
Los Angeles' Dusty Baker had an illustrious career in baseball, spending 19 seasons as a major league player and 22 more as a manager (and winning Manager of the Year three times).
But Baker, who turns 69 next week, is quick to admit he doesn't know enough. He's still learning the game. So he's been in Cleveland this summer, making his third visit to Progressive Field in 11 weeks. He's already been here to look at Indians pitching coach Mickey Callaway's work and other areas of interest in Cleveland. And when the San Francisco Giants come to Cleveland for their fourth straight game against the Indians, he'll be taking with him the pitcher who impressed in that game. Cleveland last spring. Jared Hughes, a minor league free agent the previous year, signed with the Indians and was named to the roster on Opening Day. He started two games, was designated for assignment on April 29, and was ultimately sent to Triple-A Columbus. On May 22, the Giants claimed him off waivers. fuse

A quick run-through of basic measures of investment value for shares and stock markets.
The most widely used calculation, this ratio compares a companys value with its profits. To work it out, you take the share price and divide it
continuation: by the net profit after taxes . Profits are typically calculated in two ways : net profit or operating profit .The net profit is the end result of all accounting actions , including taxes and any regulations made . The operating profit is calculated after removing various costs and costs .The higher the ratio , the higher the value is put on a companys ability to earn profits . A measure of a companys efficiency at turning its capital into revenues .The ratio is calculated by separating the net profit after taxes by the book price of gross assets . The book price of assets gives how many it would cost the company to replace all its assets , as of the financial year ending .This does not necessarily reflect the present market price of these assets . Book value / Market value This ratio represents the relationship between a companys book price and its market price .It is calculated by dividing the book price of gross assets by the stock price . Price /
translation:
A brief explanation of the main investment value indicators for stocks and the stock market.
This is the most widely used calculation. Compare a company's value and earnings. To calculate this, divide the stock price by the net income after tax. Profit is typically calculated in two ways: net income or operating income. Net income is the final result of all accounting activities, including taxes and adopted regulations. Operating income is calculated excluding miscellaneous expenses. The higher this ratio, the more valuable the company's ability to generate profits. A measure of the efficiency with which a company converts capital into revenue. This ratio is calculated by dividing net income after taxes by the book value of total assets. Asset book value shows how much it would cost a company to replace all its assets at the end of a financial year. They do not necessarily reflect the current market prices of those assets. Book value/market value. This ratio is the ratio of a company's book value to its market value. It is calculated by dividing the book value of total assets by the stock price. price /

input:
NOTTINGHAM  The sale of USA Springs property on Monday has been postponed for three months after the company filed for bankruptcy.
A representative from James St. James Auctioneers, of Manchester, which was scheduled to conduct the auction, confirmed company representatives
continuation: informed the company of the shift in status Thursday . Company administrators did not return a phone call demanding comment .Linda McCormick , broker for the company , said she believed the bankruptcy filing was brought on by recent actions by the Town of Nottingham to collect its portion of property taxation . A report from the town assessing bureau revealed the property , located at 100 Sawmill Road , was taxed at $ 36 , 757 , representing a 53 percent discount from the property ' s appraised value of $ 75 , 500 .The evaluation statement said Nottingham is owed $ 3 , 246 in taxes for the present fiscal year , which passes through June 30 . After the 2004 - 05 fiscal year ended , the town released tax notices to companies that had failed to
translation:
The sale of Nottingham U.S. Springs Real Estate was delayed for three months on Monday after the company filed for bankruptcy.
Representative of auction company James St. Manchester-based James Auctioneers, which was scheduled to conduct the auction, confirmed that company officials notified the company of the change in status on Thursday. Company administrators did not return calls seeking comment. Linda McCormick, the company's broker, said she believed the bankruptcy filing was prompted by recent moves by the city of Nottingham to collect some of its property taxes. The property, located at 100 Sawmill Road, has a tax assessed value of $36,757, which represents a 53 percent discount from the property's assessed value of $75,500, according to a report from the city assessor's office. Taxes for the current fiscal year ending June 30 are $3,246. After the end of the 2004-05 fiscal year, the city sent tax notices to businesses that were behind on their taxes.

input:
BANKS FAVORED week-long term deposits this week, resulting in a sustained decline in yields for these papers despite an uptrend seen for longer tenors.
Offers for Wednesdays auction reached P60.829 billion
continuation: , lower than last weeks P61 . 397 billion . The oversubscription rate was 0 . 39 times , which is a lot smaller than the previous auction held last week at 1 . 01 times .This shows a substantial drop in bank demand as a result of a significantly greater interest rates environment , said Global Securities chief of research Jose Paolo Dy . Offers at the auction for P60 billion allotted 1 . 5 weeks to 2 years were reduced to P34 billion from P44 . 617 billion last month .Bids on the four - month to six - month section remained at P26 . 829 billion . Demand from non - banking organizations was especially subdued for the longer tenors , which reveals us that the banks are run out of maturity for their established term deposit liabilities , Dy said .
translation:
This week, banks gave preference to weekly deposits, and yields on these securities fell steadily, even though the longer maturities saw an upward trend.

The amount of winning bids in Wednesday's auction reached 60.829 billion pesos, down from 61.397 billion last week. The oversubscription rate was 0. The number of times was 39, much less than the previous auction held last week at level 1. 01 times. Global Securities head of research Jose Paolo Dy said this indicates a significant decrease in bank demand due to the large increase in interest rates. The amount of winning bids in the auction reached 60 billion pesos. The number of times from five weeks to two years was reduced to 34 billion pesos from 44.617 billion last month. The number of times for four- to six-month notes remained at 26.829 billion. Dy said demand from nonbanks was sluggish, especially for longer maturities, which indicates that banks are overdue for their prescribed fixed deposit obligations.

input:
Although final results are not expected until later, the scale of the predicted victory is such that the ruling Congress party has admitted defeat.
BJP leader Narendra Modi tweeted: "India has won. Good times ahead."
This is the most resounding
continuation: election victory the BJP has ever won and , for the first time , the party has won a decisive victory in a southern state . But the Congress party has never been defeated so heavily in a general election .With results from the remainder of the nation expected over the last two days , that means Mr Modi is on course for the biggest victory by a prime minister since the days of the " Law secretary " Rajiv Gandhi . Following his resounding victory in Uttar Pradesh state , with a majority in the Lok Sabha , the BJP ' s Mr Modi is in pole position to become India ' s prime minister .A BJP win would bring an ending to Congress rule which has been in power since 2004 . The result of the general election has additionally ensured that Congress will lose control of every one of the 13 states they won in the 2012 state
translation:
The final outcome will be predicted later, but the scale of the expected victory is such that the ruling Congress party has conceded defeat.
BJP leader Narendra Modi tweeted: "India has won. Good times are ahead."
This is the biggest electoral victory ever won by the Bharatiya Janata Party and the first time the party has won a decisive victory in a southern state. However, this is the first time that the National Congress party has suffered such a severe defeat in a general election. Results are also expected from the rest of the country in the remaining two days, meaning Mr Modi is on course for the biggest victory for a prime minister since Solicitor General Rajiv Gandhi. Mr. Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party has won a landslide victory in Uttar Pradesh and a majority in Sabah, putting him in a good position to become India's prime minister. A victory for the BJP would end the Congress's grip on power. Since 2004. The results of the general election further ensure that the Congress will lose control of each of the 13 states it won in 2012.

High tide has passed in Cork city without flooding although a flood warning remains in place for part of the city centre during tomorrow morning's high tide.
The council says high tides and potentially high winds may cause flooding between 6am and 8am tomorrow morning
continuation: in Rushbrooke at the bottom of Patrick Street . Cork ' s Flood Warning system is now in place .It ' s up and ran again now and the council thinks a precautionary Flood Warning is in place for Friday . Much of Cork city ' s shoreline is at risk of tidal flooding during tomorrow ' s high tide and any windstorms .The council thinks the most endangered areas are Rushbrooke , Ballinlough , Blackpool , Raffeen , Monahan ' s , Aghada and Ballincollig . The council has advised the public to be aware and to keep an eye out for changes to the scheme ' s flood alert and warning levels .In case of an emergency, the council asks that the public dial 999 or 112 and if the council, the Gardai
translation:
Cork city's high tide has passed without flooding, but a flood warning remains in place for parts of the city center during tomorrow morning's high tide.
The council says high tides and potentially strong winds could cause flooding in Rushbrook, at the end of Patrick Street, between 6am and 8am tomorrow. Cork's flood warning system is now in place. Things have now been restored and the council believes a flood warning will be issued on Friday. Much of Cork City's coastline is at risk of storm surge flooding during tomorrow's high tides and storms. The council believes the areas most at risk are Rushbrook, Ballinlough, Blackpool, Loughin, Monahans, Agada and Ballincollig. The council advised the public to stay informed and monitor changes in flood warning levels and alert levels. In the event of an emergency, the council is asking the public to call 999 or 112.

Dedicating a Sunday in May to sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ through music is a long-standing tradition at Wheaton's Gary United Methodist Church.
On Sunday, May 20, during the 9 and 11 a.m. services, the
continuation: GUMC Praise Team will be performing " I Need You More , " " I Bow Down " and " Soon & Very Soon . " In keeping with the faith ' s mission statement of " Sharing Christ ' s Love in Word & Deed , " the team ' s song selections complement the third chapter of Hebrews , which concerns with a life devoted to serving God .The tracks selected reflect a desire to connect worshipers to the message of their faith and to the community of faith . The music of each of the selections emphasizes the gratitude to God , even in hard times , and a joyful spirit that proclaims the love of Christ .On the night before he was arrested , Jesus prayed that his disciples might be united in one body . Today , Wheaton ' s Gary United Methodist Church , one of several churches in the greater Chicago area , strives to be a community dedicated to that vision .
translation:
It is a long-standing tradition of Gary Wheaton United Methodist Church to dedicate a Sunday in May to sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ through music.

On Sunday, May 20, during the 9 and 11 a.m. services, the GUMC worship team will perform "I Need You More," "I Bow Down," and "Soon and Very Soon." The team's song selections, "Sharing Christ's Love in Word and Deed," complement the third chapter of the Letter to the Hebrews, which is about living a life of service to God. The tracks selected reflect a desire to connect believers to the message of faith and to the community of faith. The music in each passage emphasizes a joyful spirit of thanksgiving to God and of proclaiming the love of Christ, even in difficult times. The night before Jesus was arrested, he prayed for his disciples to be united in one body. Today, Gary Wheaton United Methodist Church is one of several churches in the greater Chicago area that strive to be a community committed to this vision.

Stocks: Emerging from a month-long funk?
April has been a tough month for investors, with the Nasdaq taking a sharp dive and the other major markets languishing in negative territory.
But U.S. stock futures were pointing
continuation: to a higher opening Monday , giving analysts confidence that the market has finally put the volatility of the first quarter behind it . The question now is whether the bounce will be sufficient to setting off a broader rebound .The week ' s major news , apart from the first quarter numbers , is the U . S . - China trade deal . President Donald Trump expressed over the night that he believes that tariffs on Chinese goods will remain in place , but he will still announce " Phase One " of the deal that has been agreed upon with Beijing .Trump has also said he ' s willing to make other guarantees , such as reducing tariffs on Chinese electronics and apparel , in order to keep U . S . consumers satisfied . " With the news come out of the U . S . trade agreements with China . . .I believe the markets will heal and shift higher , " said
translation:
Stocks: Is there a way out of the month-long crisis?
April was a tough month for investors, with the Nasdaq plummeting and other major markets also falling into negative territory.
However, U.S. stock futures were trading higher at the start of trading on Monday, giving analysts confidence that the market has finally resolved the volatility of the first quarter. The question is whether this rebound will be enough to trigger a widespread rebound. In addition to the first quarter indicators, the main news this week is the US indexes. S. - Trade Agreement with China. In the evening, President Donald Trump said he believed tariffs on Chinese goods would remain in place, but that he intended to announce a "phase one" agreement reached with the Chinese government. President Trump also said he was prepared to do this. Other guarantees include lower tariffs on Chinese-made electronics and clothing to satisfy U.S. consumers. "As news comes out about the U.S.-China trade deal...I believe the market will recover and move higher," he said.

"Iberico pork with grilled calam
continuation: ari and shellfish . Here we are , one week into Masterchef Australia Season 10 and we are already facing some uncertainty .Not just about who will go home next , but over something that has bedevilled our nation for countless years : the pronunciation of chorizo . Actor and self - declared meat lover Kurt Fearnley using his final MasterChef meal party to give Australia some closure on this burning topic , and Twitter users are pretty split on how to pronounce it .' You said chorizo , I say chor - ee - soh , ' he informed the cameras . ' And that ' s how we should all pronounce it . 'One listener obviously hadn ' t been listening , and tweeted that he pronounced it like ' cold soy ' . translation:

"Fried Iberian pork, calamari and clams. MasterChef Australia season 10 has started for a week and we're already facing some uncertainty. input: PHILADELPHIA  Today, electrophysiologists from Penn Medicine implanted the regions first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) for sudden cardiac arrest, a potentially fatal electrical malfunction
continuation: of the heart that can cause death or left the heart totally damaged . The subcutaneous defibrillator using a pulse generator constructed to stand under the flesh and connect to the heart via electrodes inserted just below the flesh in the upper chest .In past decades , various such machines have been authorized for use , but were now the first to implant one in the region . The new implant allows for more patient comfort , greater procedure time and increased cosmetic outcomes , while reaching the same goal as standard devices to reduce sudden suicide due to hazardous heart rhythms , said Sandeep Sinha , MD , a Penn Medicine cardiologist and associate professor of Medicine in the Perelman School of Medicine .He added , Although these devices are typically indicated in those who have experienced rapid cardiac arrest or are at high danger for it , we anticipate that the subcutaneous ICD will appeal to more patients
translation: PHILADELPHIA Today, Penn Medicine electrophysiologists diagnosed sudden cardiac arrest, a fatal electrical malfunction of the heart that can cause death or permanent damage to the heart. In response to the arrest, we implanted the region's first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD). Subcutaneous defibrillators use a pulse generator designed to be placed under the skin and connected to the heart via electrodes inserted just under the skin in the upper chest. One in the area. The new implant achieves the same goals as standard devices: increasing patient comfort, extending surgical time, and improving cosmetic outcomes, while reducing sudden suicide due to dangerous heart rhythms, Penn State says. said Dr. Sandeep Sinha, a cardiologist and associate professor of medicine at the university. . At Perelman School of Medicine. He added: "While these devices are typically prescribed for people who have experienced rapid cardiac arrest or are at high risk for it, we expect subcutaneous ICDs to appeal to a wider range of patients." Ta.

translation:

DLP Products Introduces New Pico Projection Development Three Manufacturers Announce Support for DLP Projection on Mobile Devices DALLAS - October 31, 2006 - DLP Products today announced DLP Pico, the next generation DLP technology to be showcased at SID Display Week. announced. input: HOUSTON - Feb. 17, 2018 - PRLog -- Demetria Smith is a mortgage broker and community activist. She recently made headlines when the Democratic Party wrongly bumped her from the primary ballot, over a banking mix-up that caused her filing
continuation: documents to be misplaced . Smith fought back and challenged the four - term incumbent in the Democratic Party Primary and is now looking ahead to the general election in May ." Being omitted from the primary election was a surprise , but it made me realize just how important it is for every voter to come out and voting in the General election in May , " added Smith . " We should be grateful for the opportunity to vote in this country and all persons of vote age should make their voice heard . "Smith hopes to be the first African - American female to be elected to the Texas House of Representatives for District 148 , which is in Houston . Smith explained that if she is successful in her candidacy , she plans to invest in the neighborhood and schools ." We need more quality schools courses and employment skills to keep our teens off the streets and out of gangs , " added Smith .
translation: Houston - February 17, 2018 - PRLog - Demetria Smith is a mortgage broker and community activist. She recently made headlines after Democrats mistakenly excluded her from their primary election after her registration documents were lost due to a mix-up in her bank transactions. Smith fought back, challenging the incumbent for a fourth term in the Democratic primary, and now looks forward to the general election in May. ``Voters should go to the polls in the general election in May,'' Smith added. We should be grateful for the opportunity to vote in this country, and every person of voting age should have their voice heard, said Smith, House No. 148 in Houston. She hopes to become the first African American woman elected to the Texas House of Representatives from her district. Smith explained that if her candidacy is successful, she plans to invest in neighborhoods and schools. She added: "We need better education and employment skills to keep teenagers off the streets and off gangs."

translation:

The footage was shot during the final stages of the Sri Lankan army's battle against the separatist Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE).
Alston said
continuation: his investigators had watched the footage , and that it " remains genuine " , but had been unable to identify exactly when it was taken . While some of the troops have civilian dress , it is difficult to identify whether these are combatants who have sought to mix in with civilians for purposes of strategic or tactical advantage . " Alston was spoke after a four - day trip to the nation in which he interviewed Sri Lankan officials and civil society groups as well as displaced people from the north of the island .In the footage , which was posted on the Internet last week , several men believed to be Tamil Tiger fighters are bound and led to a trench where they are shot . Bodies are then shoved into
translation:
A UN spokesperson said footage of Sri Lankan soldiers executing rebel fighters was genuine.
The video was shot during the final stages of the Sri Lankan army's battle against the separatist group Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE).
Mr Alston said investigators had reviewed the footage and said it was "authentic" but could not pinpoint exactly when it was taken. "The funeral appears to have been hurried and some of the bodies were already showing signs of decomposition," he said in a commentary. Some military personnel are in civilian clothes, but it is difficult to determine whether they are combatants seeking to blend in with the civilian population to gain a strategic or tactical advantage.Alston was speaking after a four-day visit to the country, where he met with Sri Lankan government officials, civil society groups and displaced people from the north of the island, footage posted online last week showed. Several men, believed to be Tiger fighters, were seen being detained and taken away. Their bodies were then dumped in a ditch.

Max Levchin, the founder of recently-acquired Slide and co-founder of PayPal, has been named Google's newest vice president of engineering.
Levchin joined the company as part of Google's $182 million acquisition of Slide, the company
continuation: he founded in 2005 . He will serve as VP of engineering , responsible for Google ' s social initiatives , which feature a handful of existing products , like Google Talk and Google Friend Connect , as well as those under development .His adding represents a substantial win for Google , which is trying to compete with Facebook in the social space . The $ 182 million buy of Slide is among Google ' s major purchases .A photograph from Levchin ' s blog reveals that the start - up impresario now sports an honorary " google . com " email address . " Holy S * * t , I ' m really working for Google now , " Levchin wrote on his blog .
translation:
Max Levchin, founder of recently acquired Slide and co-founder of PayPal, has been named Google's new vice president of engineering.
Levchin joined the company as part of its $182 million acquisition of Google Slide, which he founded in 2005. As vice president of engineering, he will be responsible for Google's social initiatives, including existing and in-development products such as Google Talk and Google Friend Connect. His appointment is a big win for Google as it seeks to compete with Facebook in the social space. The $182 million acquisition of Slide ranks among Google's largest acquisitions. A photo on Levchin's blog shows that the upstart impresario now has the prestigious "google.com" email address for him. "Damn, I actually work at Google now," Levchin wrote on his blog.

Around 2000, my colleague Verlin started bringing his Mac to New York Times editorial board meetings. The rest of us leaned back to look at the screen, all of us feeling that this privilege should be available to everyone. We expected meetings to have the same level of transparency as policy-making. It took us years, but we actually won the battle to open all meetings to all journalists and journalists. Boards of directors are now smaller and employees interact with each other primarily online. We use Slack, a team collaboration system, to make choices and solve problems. Slack has public channels where you can have discussions, post documents, and make other comments. All such discussions, posts, and comments may be made public. There's still a place for face-to-face conversations, but Slack has greatly expanded the types of conversations you can have. For example, we can talk about the stories and situations we are dealing with.

Researchers have developed a new compound that may soon be developed into an effective treatment for melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer.
Melanoma may be halted by a newly developed drug.
Skin cancer is the most pervasive form of cancer in
continuation: the United States . It impacts roughly 3 . 5 million people each year .Approximately 100 , 000 instances of melanoma - the deadliest type of skin cancer - are diagnosed each season . The skin cancer originates in melanocytes - the cells that produce pigment - and spreads to other parts of the bodies through the lymphatic network .It can also spread via the bloodstream . In 2017 , more than 6 , 000 persons in the United States died from melanoma .Although the infection is fewer prevalent in Europe , an estimated 12 , 500 individuals will die from it each year there , too . With melanoma , the first line of defense is prevention : decreasing the danger of exposure to ultraviolet ( UV ) radiation , either from the sun or sunbeds .U
translation:
Researchers have developed a new compound that could be an effective treatment for melanoma, the most deadly skin cancer.
Melanoma can be stopped with newly developed drugs.
Skin cancer is the most common form of cancer in the United States. This affects approx. Approximately 100,000 cases of melanoma, the most deadly skin cancer, are diagnosed each year. Skin cancer begins in melanocytes, cells that produce pigment, and spreads to other parts of the body through the lymphatic system. It can also spread through the bloodstream. In 2017, more than 6,000 people died from melanoma in the United States. Although this infection is less common in Europe, it is estimated that 12,500 people die each year. When it comes to melanoma, the first line of defense is prevention. This means reducing the risk of exposure to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from both the sun and tanning beds.

input: President Donald Trump tweeted on Tuesday about prisoners of war, and was immediately and deservedly deluged with replies and retweets regarding the late Sen. John McCain, a former POW with whom Trump frequently clashed and who he famously insulted over being captured
continuation: in war . After McCain was diagnosed with brain cancer and death in August , Trump published a statement saying hed never get into it with McCain again .Trump again focused on POWs in the same tweet , said their status as hostages of war is not what creates us a unique nation , rather it is something in their soul that does . Trump obviously misspoke here , as he had throughout his campaign and presidency , but it is perhaps worth unpacking what makes the term captive of war significant in the first place , and how it forms the basis for some of the most important rules in warfare .The First Geneva Convention of 1864 adopted the modern rules for prisoner of war status . translation: President Donald Trump tweeted about POWs on Tuesday, and unsurprisingly, he was bombarded with replies and retweets about the late Senator John McCain, a former POW who frequently clashed with President Trump and was held up for insulting acts. War. Following McCain's diagnosis of brain cancer and his death in August, President Trump issued a statement saying he would never discuss the subject with McCain again. In the same tweet, President Trump again focused on POWs, saying their status as hostages of war does not make us a special nation, but rather it is something that is in their souls. While Trump is obviously wrong here, as he has done throughout his campaign and presidency, it may be worth considering what the term "prisoner of war" means in the first place, and how it forms the basis for some of the most important rules of war. The First Geneva Convention of 1864 adopted the modern rules on the status of prisoners of war. The first section was titled "Treatment of Persons Taken in Case of War" and was written specifically to replace normal practice.

A railroad groups lawsuit against a state plan to remove 34 miles of train tracks has been delayed again, this time until the end of January.
Suzanne Messer, a lawyer for the Adirondack Railway Preservation Society, said
continuation: she received an email from solicitor Matthew C . Davison , who represents the state , Monday night . The letter , which Messer sent on her website , davismesser . com , said the attorney generals office is requesting for a 14 - day extension , and the judge agreed to the delay .The organization had been set to come to court Nov . 29 . The dispute centers on planning by the state to remove the tracks and return the territory , most of which is in the towns of Tupper Lake and Ray Brook , to its natural state .The organization , sometimes called as ARPS , is suing , arguing the state doesnt have the right to remove the tracks because the company has a 99 - year lease with the state . Adirondack Recreation Corp . has been working on the plan since 2014 , and the state has indicated its a necessary remedy for
translation:
The railroad group's lawsuit against the state's plan to remove 34 miles of track has been postponed again, this time until the end of January.
Suzanne Messer, an attorney for the Adirondack Railroad Preservation Society, said she received an email Monday night from Matthew S. Davison, an attorney representing the state. A letter sent by Mr. Messer to the website davismesser. com reported that the attorney general's office asked for a 14-day extension and the judge agreed to the extension. The organization was scheduled to appear in court in November. 29. The dispute centers on the state's plan to remove the railroad tracks and return the area, which includes much of Tupper Lake and the town of Raybrook, to its natural state. The organization, also known as ARPS, is suing, claiming the state has no right to remove the tracks because the company has a 99-year lease with the state. The Adirondack Recreation Corporation has been working on this plan since 2014, and the state has indicated this is a necessary relief.

BOSTON -- CC Sabathia snapped out of his Red Sox funk, striking out 10 in six innings to beat Boston for the first time in five tries this season and lead the New York Yankees to a 5-2 victory Tuesday.
The win
continuation: completed the Yankees ' first four - game sweep since a year - high win streak lasted five games in May . They have won eight straight overall .Sabathia ( 6 - 5 ) had lost four of five decisions against Boston coming in and hadn ' t won at Fenway Park since a 2 - 0 victory on Aug . 8 , 2012 , in the middle of the playoff hunt . He gave up only one run and five hits , walked none and had four strikeouts in the second .Baltimore scored five hits off leaving - hander Mike Morin in the bottom of the inning , though it didn ' t end up mattering .
translation:
BOSTON  CC Sabathia escaped a Red Sox scare, had 10 strikeouts in six innings, and led the New York Yankees to a 5-2 victory over Boston for the first time in five tries this season on Tuesday.
With this victory, the Yankees' winning streak ended at four games for the first time since their best winning streak of the year extended to five games in May. In total, it was 8 consecutive wins. Sabathia (6-5) has lost four of five decisions against Boston and hasn't won at Fenway Park since a 2-0 win in August. December 8, 2012, in the midst of the playoff race. In the second inning, he allowed only five hits, one run, no walks, and four strikeouts. Baltimore got five hits from left-hander Mike Morin in the bottom of the inning, but it ultimately didn't matter.

input: In a shameful first, in 2016 TN Assembly elections, polling in two constituencies was put off due to the pernicious effect of money power, to quote the EC. In a telling indictment of the States political class
continuation: , 13 Assembly and 1 Lok Sabha seats have been categorised as critical , on account of their past data of booth capturing , bogus voting and other irregularities . Of these , 10 ( five each from Coimbatore and Karur regions ) are classified as very important Tamil Nadu has the highest number of constituencies in this category .Elections to the 234 districts will be held in a single phase on May 16 . CEC Nasim Zaidi has confirmed that 70 , 000 ( out of 8 . 5 lakh ) polling personnel and around 1 . 5 lakh ( out of 22 lakh ) polling stations will be first time voting .This , for a by - election in Chennai . In a worst - case situations , the poll bodies will need a re - poll in
translation: According to the EC, the first shameful development was the postponement of voting in two constituencies in the 2016 Tennessee Assembly elections due to the negative influence of money power. In a strong indictment against the state's political class, 13 seats in parliament and one in Sabah were classified as critical seats due to a past record of polling station snatching, shaming elections and other irregularities. Of these, 10 (5 each from Coimbatore and Karur regions) have been classified as highly important. Tamil Nadu has the highest number of constituencies in this category. Elections for 234 constituencies will be held all at once on May 16th. CEC Naseem Zaidi admitted that his polling staff is about 1 out of 70,000 (out of 850,000). 500,000 polling stations (out of 2.2 million) will be voting for the first time. This is a by-election in Chennai. In the worst case scenario, election officials would have to re-run the vote.

translation:

input: NEW YORK  One recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an ecstatic e-mail that gravitational forces were causing two stars to orbit each other, with one star swallowing matter from its companion. Rudolf Novak received the same message
continuation: . They soon discover the two are halfway around the world from each other , yet at that very instant , the stars were hovering each other within two light years .Such a coincidence would be rare , but for Foote , 32 , a black hole expert , and Novak , 27 , a planetary scientist , it was the latest in a string of unexpected exchanges , putting together two worlds whose obsession with mass gravity events has its own gravitational pull .
translation: NEW YORK One recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an exciting email that gravity was causing two stars to orbit each other and one star was consuming material from its companion star. . Rudolf Novak received the same message. They soon discovered that the two were half a distance from each other, but at that moment the stars were hovering two light years above each other. Such a coincidence would have been rare if black hole expert Foote, 32, and planetary scientist Novak, 27, had not been the latest in a series of unexpected interactions that have brought together two obsessed worlds. . Large-scale gravitational events have their own gravitational pull.

input:
SCRIBA, N.Y. - The refueling outage at the Unit 2 reactor at Nine Mile Point nuclear station provides a rare opportunity to go inside the plant while the reactor vessel is opened up.
Photographers from Syracuse.com took advantage
continuation: of the chance to capture some of the scenes inside the unit . The photos below depict Unit 2 ' s nuclear vessel after the turbine - generator unit was withdrawn , and the tank where the reactor coolant and steam is stored .The photos below show the removal of the turbine - generator unit , the reactor control room , and the spent fuel pool , where fuel from Unit 2 and Unit 3 is stored . The other pictures show steam turbines and the inlet building , where spent fuel is received and handled .
translation:

Syracuse.com photographers had the opportunity to capture some of the interior scenes. The photo below shows the reactor building of Unit 2 after the turbine generator was removed, and the tanks that store reactor coolant and steam. Spent fuel pool where fuel from Units 2 and 3 is stored. Other photos show the steam turbine and the entrance building where spent fuel is received and processed.

The gritty streets of this 4-by-12-block sliver of a town in densely populated and urbanized northern Hudson County might be the last place to expect to find a largely volunteer fire department.
Such departments are usually associated with small-
continuation: town Main Streets , such as the one in Bayonne . But the Union City Fire Department has been one of the best - run and most respected agencies in the state for more than 60 years .It was the first , and continues the largest , department in the state to be majority woman . The boys are fiercely protective of their ladies in red , and they enjoy a healthy rivalry with the Teterboro Volunteer Fire Department , which employs about 10 women .The Teterboro department sits just on the other side of Route 46 , but the women in red regard the boys in the department ' s yellow uniforms as rivals . The 200 Union City female firefighters are treated by their male colleagues as royalty .As the comradery grew , the relationship between the Teterboro men and the Union City ladies emerged into a
translation:
The gritty streets of this 4-by-12-block town in densely populated and urbanized northern Hudson County might not be the place you'd expect to find a mostly volunteer fire department.
Such departments are typically associated with the main streets of small towns such as Bayonne. But for more than 60 years, the Union City Fire Department has been one of the best-run and most respected agencies in the state. This was the state's first and still largest female-majority chapter. The boys fiercely protect the women in red and have some healthy competition with the Teterboro Volunteer Fire Department, which has about 10 women. Teterboro County is on the other side of Highway 46, but the women in red are rivals with the boys in yellow county uniforms. Her 200 female firefighters in Union City are treated like royalty by their male firefighters. As camaraderie grew, the relationship between Teterboro men and Union City women evolved.

input:
MALAYSIA IS willing to help Thailand end the ethno-religious conflict in the deep South using peaceful means, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said yesterday, suggesting the root cause of the problem was not religion but injustice.
G
continuation: rowing brutality in the restive region has died more than 6 , 000 persons since 2004 . It seems to me if they can manage their social system in a way that ensures justice and equality in the distribution of resources and income , they can answer their problem without too little difficulty , he informed journalists after attending Putrajayas Health Clinic for the Elderly , which is named after him .He was asked about the conditions attached by Thailand to any partnership on the conflict . I believe one reason is they wish to assist .They have been through this kind of problem . translation:
Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said yesterday that Malaysia stands ready to help Thailand end ethnic and religious conflicts in the deep south through peaceful means, suggesting that the root cause of the problem is injustice, not religion. did.
Since 2004, violence has escalated in rebel areas, claiming more than 6,000 lives. I think problems can be solved without much difficulty if we manage our social systems in a way that ensures fairness and equality in the distribution of resources and income, he said during a visit to the Putrajaya Elderly Clinic named after him. translation:

"With this win, the Kings move into sole second place in the Western Conference. translation:
Once upon a time, Ronald Reagan launched America's Strategic Defense Initiative. This missile defense project was quickly derided by critics as Star Wars, pure fantasy.
Ronald Reagan's Star Wars. (Associated Press) The phrase sounds completely different now, but we're going to find out if the technology behind President Reagan's fantasy has finally come true. Boeing and Raytheon will , will launch a rocket with a payload for the first time at a small, remote missile test site in the Mojave Desert, the last test flight of the Air Force's intermediate-range land defense program. The actual payload, called an impact vehicle, is a shiny 220-pound box with a shaped explosive called a warhead designed to destroy incoming missiles.

Swirling dust devils on Mars have given NASA scientists both a scientific treat and a very welcome power boost.
On 10 March, the rover Spirit captured images of two dust devils in one day. It is the first time any have been seen on Mars
continuation: , although they are common on Earth . The dust devils were detected by Spirit ' s mast camera , which had been specially designed to manage the severe environment of Mars .The mast sensor takes panoramic images at 300 - nanometre resolution and has very high dynamic range , allowing it to take images of the sun and skies . translation:

The EU's statistical agency Eurostat published the survey statistics on behalf of the European Commission, the European Union's executive agency. The survey was conducted from November 2007 to February 2008 among more than 27,000 respondents aged 15 and older in 27 countries. EU member states. Seven percent of respondents in the UK, Italy, Sweden and Ireland said Israel poses the greatest threat to world peace, while 8% of respondents in Poland and the Czech Republic said the same.
