input: If President Clinton wants to see how activist government can solve social problems with strong public support, he should take a few days to visit Canada. With Toronto's World Series victory, the nationwide referendum on constitutional reform (including the status of Quebec), and the
continuation: political firestorm over the Quebec referendum , there ' s been a plenty of talk about the inadequacies of the US system . At the same time , in a sign of how far matters have went in Canada , the Toronto Star editorialized against the referendum legislation because it infringed too much on civil liberties .The Canadian system has some things in its favor . The country is more homogeneous and wealthy than the US and has fewer sharp divisions .There are local and provincial differences , but in Canada they are far less sharp than in the US . Canada also has much more public participation .Some of the policy innovations - - equalization paid to poorer provinces , bilingual schooling in Quebec , army duty for aboriginal citizens - - were passed only because public opinion prompted the federal government to shift . At the same time , the federal government ' s role in public affairs is much larger than in the US .Canadian statutes are often
translation: If President Clinton wants to see how an activist government can address social issues with strong public support, he should visit Canada for a few days. After Toronto's World Series victory, the referendum on constitutional reform (including Quebec status), and the political storm surrounding the Quebec referendum, there was a lot of talk about the imperfections of the American system. At the same time, showing how far things have progressed in Canada, the Toronto Star published an editorial opposing the referendum law as too restrictive of civil liberties. The Canadian system has several advantages. The country is more homogeneous, wealthier, and less sharply divided than the United States. There are regional and state differences, but they are not as great in Canada as they are in the United States. In Canada, public participation is also much greater. Some innovative policies, such as equalizing payments to poorer provinces, bilingual education in Quebec, and conscription of Aboriginal people, were adopted simply because public opinion pushed the federal government to make changes. At the same time, the federal government's role in public affairs is much larger than in the United States.

Gov. Parris N. Glendening is seriously considering vetoing legislation that would make Maryland the first state to require that all public school students take a gun safety class.

continuation: the future could look like for tomorrow ' s aging adults , but for society in general . translation:
In the police officer recruitment exam, you must try to answer all the questions.
2 What are the grounds for disqualification from police recruitment?
For new police officers, the psychological evaluation process is one of the last hurdles to hiring. The purpose of the psychological evaluation is to identify problematic behaviors and ensure that the candidate is a safe person and does not have a history of violent behavior. Psychological assessment results cannot be changed, but candidates can provide additional information if the evaluator has questions about the results. No single behavioral evaluation statistic can prevent you from hiring a candidate. Instead, psychological evaluations are designed to provide a comprehensive overview of an applicant's mental health, temperament, and general condition. A person may experience setbacks or difficulties in one or two categories, but be okay in the other categories. After all, everyone has weaknesses and is likely to have to deal with physical or mental health issues at some point in their life. Certain types of issues are more likely to prevent a candidate from being hired than others. Psychological assessments are designed to identify and provide an overview of challenging behaviors.

input:
As Athens goes to the polls, has the British left fallen out of love with the EU?
In 1874, Karl Marx had an imaginary conversation with Mikhail Bakunin. Nowadays, they would just have had a Twitter spat, but back then
continuation: they were distinct and the terms of the debate were distinct . The gist of the debate concerned whether the Paris Commune was a purely phenomenal happening or a purely dialectical happening , and its ultimate import .To Marx , it was the former , a barricade of stones and mortar that would offer a transition to the Paris Commune of the future . To Bakunin , it was the latter : an instance of peoples struggles for emancipation from capitalism , a prototype of the revolution .Marx was willing to be proved wrong . It is this spirit of testing , challenging and pushing against the grain that is undoubtedly the most missed element of the debates within the Labour Party and wider left over Brexit .The form of the discourse has altered . In part it is a consequence of the way politics now operates : too
translation:
As Athens goes to the polls, are the British left feeling less attached to the European Union?
In 1874, Karl Marx had an imaginary conversation with Mikhail Bakunin. Nowadays we just argue on Twitter, but back then it was different and the terms of discussion were different. The core of the debate concerned whether the Paris Commune was a purely phenomenal or purely dialectical event, and its ultimate meaning. For Marx, this was the first barricade of stone and mortar that would ensure the future transition of the Paris Commune. For Bakunin, it was the latter, an example of the people's struggle for liberation from capitalism, and a prototype for revolution. Marx was prepared to be proven wrong. This spirit of testing, challenging and putting pressure on structures is arguably the most overlooked element in Labor and wider Brexit debates. The form of speech has changed. This is partly a result of the current way politics is done.

translation: ZURB, the maker of apps like Bounce, Notable, Reel, and Strike, has released another web app called Spur. I would venture to say that many she web developers often over complicate things. Spur is an application that helps simplify the website design process. Paparazzi who took photographs of Princess Diana dying in a car wreck stopped police from getting to the scene, her inquest heard today.
Eyewitness Clifford Goorovadoo said: "It is true that when the first police officers

2 What if a Salaried Employee Works More Than 40 Hours?
Ask two workers if they prefer a salary or hourly wage, you will likely get two different answers
continuation: . Some individuals will say a pay is more stable and predictable than an hourly wage .Others say an hourly wage offers more certainty that they will be paying for the hours they work . translation:
Hourly workers aren't the only ones who need to track their work hours.
2 What should I do if an employee works more than 40 hours?
If you ask two workers whether he prefers a salary or an hourly wage, he will probably get two different answers. Some people may find that pay is more stable and predictable than hourly wages. Some people find that paying by the hour gives them confidence that they're getting paid for the hours they work. However, whether a person chooses to pay an hourly rate or a wage, the employer is responsible for paying the worker for the hours worked and any required overtime. If an employee doesn't track his or her work hours, that employee's pay could be in trouble. Determine whether the employee in question is exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act. In accordance with U.S. law, salaried employees may be paid an annual salary or paid per pay period based on the number of hours worked. . C. Wage and Hour Division of the Department of Labor. Employers are usually required to pay an hourly rate.

A motorcyclist from Worthing suffered fatal injuries following a collision with two cars on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
The 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing collided with a Jaguar travelling in
continuation: the opposite direction on the B2184 , left him with fatal injuries . The cyclist was treated by the South East Coast Ambulance Service before being transferred to Southampton General Hospital where he later died .The crash , which occurred at 1 . 20pm on Tuesday ( September 13 ) , left the highway closed until around 6 . 30pm . The pilot of the Jaguar , a 51 - year - old guy from Worthing , was not injured .Meanwhile , a 22 - year - old woman from Harrow , who was driving a BMW , suffered minor wounds . A officers spokeswoman said : " We are appealing for witnesses to come forward , as well as anything who might have captured dash cam footage . "She added : " Officers from the severe crash investigation team are appealing for witnesses
translation:
A Worthing motorcyclist was fatally injured in a two-vehicle collision on the A286 at Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
A 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing suffered fatal injuries after colliding with an oncoming Jaguar on the B2184. The cyclist was treated by South East Coast Ambulance Service and then taken to Southampton General Hospital, where he died. The accident occurred at 1 o'clock. At 8pm on Tuesday, September 13th, the highway was closed to traffic until approximately 6am. 3.30pm. The pilot of the Jaguar, a 51-year-old from Worthing, was uninjured. Meanwhile, a 22-year-old woman from Harlow who was driving the BMW suffered minor injuries. A police spokesperson said: ``We are appealing to witnesses as well as anyone who may have been seen on dashcams to come forward.'' She added: "Officials from the Serious Accident Investigation Team are appealing for witnesses."

input: Amazon has announced another twist on the Fire TV in the form of the Fire TV Cube. If you imagine the functionality of the Fire TV, combine it with an Echo Dot and add in a bit of universal remote control, you've arrived at the Fire
continuation: TV Cube . The Fire TV Cube brings Alexa speech control to the Fire TV experience , meaning you can command the whole experience simply by ask for it .You ' ll be able to navigate around your streaming library , or even control your home appliances - all just by ask for it . The Fire TV Cube additionally offers universal control for your home ' s smart machines , including an IR blaster that grants you complete control over your television and all your other smart home phones .The Fire TV Cube isn ' t just for controlling your television . It also enables you make and receive calls , and command your smart home .The box is just as elegant and stylish as the Fire TV Stick , with an ethernet cable , USB cable and power cord also included . This means you can take control of your entire experience just by asking. You can also interact with your streaming library and control your home appliances, all on demand. For this . Additionally, Fire TV Cube offers universal control of your home's smart devices, including an IR blaster that gives you complete control over your TV and all your other smart home phones. Fire TV Cube isn't just for controlling your TV. You can also make and receive calls, control your smart home, and more. The box is as sleek and stylish as the Fire TV Stick, and also includes an Ethernet cable, USB cable, and power cord. Amazon Fire TV Cube is currently available for pre-order in the UK and Germany. Delivery to the UK will begin on July 26th.

Just this week, Alaska and Washington joined Colorado and Washington in legalizing recreational use of marijuana. On Election Day, residents of Arkansas, Florida, Massachusetts, and North Dakota voted to legalize medical marijuana, while Montana and Ohio voted to decriminalize marijuana. Legalization activists say if trends continue, nearly half of the country's population will live in states where marijuana is legal. As legalization spreads, so too have concerns about the health and safety effects of growing marijuana indoors. This is where butane comes into play. Before marijuana was legalized in Colorado and Washington, home cultivation was done in dark, dingy basements and closets. Things are changing. Now that cultivation has become big business, family businesses are moving out of neighborhood basements and into factories.

Pat Fitzgerald received more than $2.2 million in compensation in the 2011 calendar year, the NU athletics department announced Friday. His contract makes him the highest-paid coach in school history. During the 2011 calendar year, Northwestern University's football program supported the athletic department's wide range of athletic needs and helped the university reward, retain and train top talent. high-level student-athletes, the athletic department said in a statement. Northwestern is ranked in the Big Ten and 20th in the nation in revenue in 2010, according to USA Today. In college it was $61. Sports revenue this year was $2 million, second only in the Big Ten to Michigan ($90 million) and Illinois ($89.6 million). The results of the 2011 College Football Playoff have been announced.

translation:
Nearly three weeks after the primary that defeated two incumbents, the remaining candidates for Carroll County Commissioner are struggling to show voters that they are very different from each other.
Most candidates ran successful primary campaigns by declaring that they were different. Candidates Jack Carr, Tony Movod, and Joshua Himes were successful in gaining support from Carroll voters, but with a focus on cutting taxes and spending and implementing land-use improvements. Their platforms are strikingly identical in most respects. This is crucial as we prepare for the four-way race that culminates in November. 5. All three described the competition as difficult, but that didn't stop them from talking about the tough and fair races ahead. ``I've always been someone who was willing to take a stand, and I've always been an independent,'' explained Kerr, who is the only committee member running for re-election. It will be very difficult for me to win because there are so many other candidates, but I believe the results will show that.

Neither the mayor nor the cities board has the ability to solve issues , but a broad - based pledge to solving these problems over the long - term may be a begin .The present situation did not materialize overnight . It is my hope that the council , the mayor - elect , the commercial community and all Paterson citizens commit to identifying and overcoming the challenges that so many city
translation:
Former Paterson Mayor Pat Kramer reflects on the crisis facing the city following the resignation of Joey Torres.
In light of the plea deal reached by former Paterson Mayor Joey Torres, I was asked to consider the future of our beloved city. I hesitate to do so because it is not only inappropriate for someone new to the City Commission to advise on the future of an organization as complex as the City of Paterson, but also wrong. But there's a lot we can learn from it. these incidents. First of all, there are no easy solutions to the problems facing the city of Paterson. While some challenges are clearly defined and surmountable, many are the result of years of urban struggle. Neither the mayor nor the city council has the power to fix the problems, but a radical commitment to solving these problems in the long term could be a start. The current situation did not arise overnight. I hope that the City Council, the elected mayor, the business community, and all citizens of Paterson will work to identify and overcome the problems facing many cities.

translation:
Queensland Police Minister says a violent home invasion in Murgon over the weekend was not targeted.
Mark Ryan said extra police forces were immediately sent to the area at the weekend following two brutal attacks on Friday night in which a Murgon police prosecutor was punched in the face. Senator Ryan spoke to reporters on Monday morning after visiting authorities in Murgon to find out how police are dealing with the aftermath of the violent attack. This is a shocking incident for the local community. Police have clearly taken significant steps to protect this community and local parents, he said. - In the event of a violent home invasion or emergency services such as this, it is critical that the police respond quickly. input:
Argentina labor's umbrella organization CGT, has organized a strike for Monday to protest the economic reforms being implemented y the administration of president Mauricio Macri's business friendly administration.
Tens of thousands of people have marched on Saturday in central
continuation: Buenos Aires to protest against the government ' s measures , which have been criticised for spelling the end of several state - supplied services . The recession has led many Argentines to protest in favor of a state - backed economic strategy that has saw a widening income gap and soaring poverty and inflation .Argentina ' s financial crisis came to deepen in late 2015 after a " macri bump " inflated an already overheated economy with capital inflows that had financed the nation ' s recovery from 2001 - 2002 crisis and financial crisis in 2008 . A conflict over repaying $ 100 billion of debt forced the nation to default on its overseas bond debt for the second time in 15 decades , deepening the recession , which has left the nation in recession with a devalued peso currency and a rising poverty rate
translation:
Argentina's umbrella trade union organization CGT called for a strike on Monday in protest of economic reforms under President Mauricio Macri's pro-business government.
Tens of thousands of people marched in central Buenos Aires on Saturday to protest government measures that have been criticized for cutting several public services. The recession has led many Argentines to protest in support of a government-backed economic strategy that has led to widening income inequality, soaring poverty and inflation. An overheated economy with capital inflows that financed the country's recovery from the 2001-02 crisis and the 2008 financial crisis. A dispute over $100 billion in debt repayments caused the country to default on its foreign debt for the second time in 150 years, and the depreciation of the peso and rising poverty rate deepened the recession.

input: A police chase that began in Norwalk early this morning ended in Des Moines as the man being chased jumped to his death from a parking ramp. Norwalk Police Chief Eddie Kuhl says it began with a call of a person who was possibly suicidal who
continuation: had stolen a 2013 Ford Fusion from Norwalk . Kuhl said the pursuit came through several counties with speeds of up to 100 miles an hour , and the car had no license plates .Kuhl said officers saw the man drove on Highway 218 in Warren County as he was attempting to steer to the right of a semi , but the man turned away . Authorities finally located the car on I - 80 in Warren County with a pursuit that led to the man drove into Des Moines and parking on the ramp at the intersection of I - 80 and I - 35 / 80 .The man ran from the car and climbed over the railing . Kuhl said the man tried to climb over the railing but dropped into the hole below .No one was hurt as the car was totaled as well as the semi .
translation: A police pursuit that began early this morning in Norwalk ended in Des Moines when the chased man jumped off a parking lot ramp to his death. Norwalk Police Chief Eddie Kuhl said it all started with a phone call from a man who appeared to be suicidal and had stolen a 2013 Ford Fusion from Norwalk. The pursuit went through multiple counties at speeds of up to 160 mph, Kuhl said, and the car did not have a license plate. Kuhl said the officer saw a man driving on Highway 218 in Warren County try to make a right turn from the floor, but the man swerved. After a pursuit, authorities eventually located the vehicle on Interstate 80 in Warren County, which resulted in the man getting into Des Moines and stopping at Interstate 80 and Interstate 35/80. I ended up parking on the ramp at the intersection. The man jumped out of the car and climbed over his railing. Kuhl said the man tried to climb over the railing, but he fell into the hole below. The car and semitrailer were severely damaged, but no one was injured.

input:
When a South Carolina man found a Waffle House's only employee asleep, he decided to make the food himself.
Alex Bowen was returning from a night of drinking when he visited the restaurant to satisfy an early-morning food craving.
He waited
continuation: a few minutes to be sat , but since the diner was out of eggs , Bowen decided to cook a waffle himself , ABC News reported . Bowen sat in a booth and watched an worker , who ' s not being identified , sleeping at the restaurant .When the worker gotten up and left , Bowen decided to complete the meal himself . He put a donut , bacon and an egg on top of his waffle before smothering it all in syrup .When he sat down , the dish arrived . The strange instant was caught on camera and shared to Twitter .Bowen telling WJBF News the meal he made was " exceptionally wonderful . " " It was just a really great waffle , " Bowen said ." I baked it myself and that ' s my food . " " It was definitely the best waffle I ' ve ever had , " he added .
translation:
A South Carolina man found the only employee at a Waffle House asleep and decided to cook the food himself.
Alex Bowen was returning from a night of drinking and stopped at a restaurant to satisfy his morning appetite.
Bowen waited a few minutes to be seated, but the store ran out of eggs, so she decided to make her own waffles, ABC News reported. Mr. Bowen sat in a booth and observed an unidentified employee sleeping in the restaurant. When the workers got up and left, Bowen decided to cook the food himself. He placed the donut, bacon, and egg on top of the waffle and poured syrup all over it. When I sat down, the food was brought to me. The bizarre moment was caught on camera and posted on Twitter. Bowen told WJBF News that the food he cooked was "absolutely amazing." "The waffles were really great," Bowen said. "This was definitely the best waffle I've ever had," he added.

input:
The Senate is in a standoff regarding bills that would send relief funding to Puerto Rico, which is still recovering from Hurricane Maria.
On Monday (April 1), a measure was defeated in the Senate to provide disaster relief for Puerto Rico. Democrats voted against
continuation: the bill , which unsuccessful because Republicans couldnt obtain enough votes from their own party . For reference , the bill might have provided $ 600 million in increased funding for Puerto Ricos storms relief efforts .Senator Hatch , of Utah , said in a media conference that he was disappointed that the bill failed . Im just going to put it that way .Im disappointed . It doesnt do anything to aid Puerto Rico .All it does is toss money down a rathole , and Im sick and tired of that , said Senator Hatch . Despite Senate setbacks , the Trump administration has said that Puerto Rico will getting their funding and has not given up hope .Puerto Rico has been a priority from day one . We will getting the aid funding and funding through Community Development Block Grant we require for Puerto Rico
translation:
The Senate is deadlocked over a bill that would direct relief funds to Puerto Rico as it recovers from Hurricane Maria.
The disaster relief package for Puerto Rico failed in the Senate on Monday (April 1). Democrats voted against the bill, but it died because Republicans could not get enough votes from their party. For reference, the bill could have included a $600 million increase in funding for hurricane relief in Puerto Rico. Sen. Hatch (R-Utah) said at a press conference that he was disappointed that the bill failed. I'll just say this. I'm disappointed. He does nothing to help Puerto Rico. All he's doing is throwing money down a rat hole and I'm tired of it," said Sen. Hatch. Despite the Senate setback, the Trump administration remained hopeful, saying Puerto Rico would receive funding. Puerto Rico was a priority from day one. We will receive much-needed financial assistance and community development grants for Puerto Rico.

Sharp saw sales drop 12 percent in the nine months to December as competition increased in the LCD panel and television markets, it said Wednesday.
The company saw demand for flat-screen TVs drop in markets outside of Japan and was also pinched by price
continuation: competition from its biggest rivals , Sharp said in a financial document . The corporation , which has operations in Mexico , North America and Europe , cited the dropping in its TV sales to a drop in demand in Europe .Sharp seen a 16 . 8 percent decline in television revenues in the third quarter as prices fell by 44 percent , it said . Demand for flat - panel displays , meanwhile , remained strong .
translation:
Sharp said Wednesday that sales fell 12% in the nine months to December due to increased competition in the LCD panel and TV markets.
Sharp said in its financial filing that the company is seeing declining demand for flat-screen TVs in markets outside Japan and also faces price competition from its biggest rival. The company, which has offices in Mexico, North America and Europe, blamed the decline in TV sales on lower demand in Europe. Sharp expects growth of 16%. In the third quarter, TV revenue fell 8% and prices fell 44%. Meanwhile, demand for flat panel displays remained strong.

translation:
Once considered the domain of geeks, personal opinion and diary pages - blogs or "blogs" - are now so powerful that huge corporations are starting to take an interest in them.
What started as a homepage for observational enthusiasts has become a successful marketing tool for large corporations. Some of the world's most famous brands use blogs to communicate with customers, test products on the market, and market their products. British businesses are also not far behind their global peers in extending the power of blogging. One of the most famous British brands to use this technology to engage with customers is Cadbury. The company uses the Cadbury Blogger platform to connect with followers of its best-selling Dairy Milk. ``We talk more about Cadbury Dairy to give our opinion on everything we love,'' added one blogger. A blog is a website where the owner posts about her ideas, life, and hobbies, sometimes multiple times a day. People who write blogs are called bloggers, and they range from avid pet lovers to culinary experts.

All eyes will be on Telkom and its subsidiary Vodacom to announce their annual results tomorrow.

" The reason is that we feel that the blade has spirits .We believe the spirit comes out from the blade , and it could shield the holder , " Matsuda describes in the trailer above . " That ' s why we using blades in Shinto and Buddhist ceremonies , as a key ingredient . eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) unveiled a nice little surprise for investors with its fourth-quarter earnings report. Well, nice for eBay; not
continuation: so tremendous for PayPal ( NASDAQ : PYPL ) investors . The corporation reported a solid fourth quarter , mostly thanks to its headline - grabbing purchase of GSI .However , PayPal wasn ' t almost as happy with its own business , declaring that it was end its 10 - year friendship with its transaction processing member eBay ( it also plans to move its processing activities to North America ) . This week , the company reported that it was giving its most - preferred partners for mobile payments ( notably Apple ) a third - party interest in PayPal ' s pay system .So while PayPal ' s pay processing business is thriving , it ' s clearly been trying to place itself for the future . That could create some concerns for investors in PayPal , but I believe it ' s a fairly small issue in the long run .eBay accounted
translation:
eBay ends payment processing partnership with PayPal, but let's take a closer look.

eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) released its fourth quarter earnings report and gave investors a bit of a pleasant surprise. Well, it's not a bad thing for eBay. For PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) investors, it's not so important. The company reported strong results in the fourth quarter, mainly due to the high-profile acquisition of GSI. But PayPal isn't as happy with its own business, and said it was ending a decade-long friendly relationship with eBay's transaction processing members (it also plans to move processing operations to North America). The company announced this week that it would be moving its preferred mobile payment partners (specifically Apple) from third-party payments to PayPal. So while PayPal's payment processing business is booming, it's clearly not. It's trying to position itself for the future. While this may cause concern for PayPal investors, I think it's a pretty minor issue in the long run.

A Hong Kong real estate billionaire has doubled the reward amount to any man who is willing to win over his lesbian daughters heart.
In 2012, Cecil Chao initially set the amount for $65 million after receiving news that his daughter, 33
continuation: - year - old Cecilia , was marrying a lesbian , Rebecca Wong . However , upon finding out that Wong and Chao were never officially married , he has increased the sum to $ 130 million .Cecilia , also known as Gigi Chao , said she was grateful for her fathers love and passion for her happiness . She says she did not anticipate the money would gotten her mothers consent , said My mother has her own faith .Cecilia stated she is fine with her parents . Her niece , Angelina , had departed the family home after she talked against gay marriage at a religious gathering .She says that she loves her mother , but that they dont have a close friendship . Source : EliteDaily Also Read : Business : the Japanese fisherman finds plastic trash at depth of 10 . 000 meters
translation:
A Hong Kong real estate billionaire will double the reward for any man who wants to win the heart of his lesbian daughter.
In 2012, Cecile Chao initially set the price at $65 million after news that her daughter Cecilia, 33, was to marry lesbian Rebecca Wong. However, she increased her amount to $130 million when she learned that Wong and Chao were not officially married. Cecilia, also known as her Gigi Chao, said she is grateful for her father's love and her passion for her happiness. She said she didn't expect money to get her mother's approval, and that "her mother has her own beliefs." She said Cecilia had no problems with her parents. Her niece Angelina left home after she spoke out against same-sex marriage at a religious gathering. She loves her mother, she says, but she says they have no close friendship. translation: Interior designer Abby Fenimore knew adding a kitchen island was one of the most important decisions she made when renovating her 1940s Dallas home. input: Ethiopia says despite its trade relations with Somalias breakaway enclave of Somaliland, it does not support the sovereignty of the self-declared republic. Ethiopian foreign minister Seyoum Mesfin says Somaliland deserves to be
continuation: given a chance , to mend its fences with Somalia . Seyoum was spoke during a media briefing in Addis Ababa .We see Somaliland as an essential part of Somalia and we dont think Somaliland can distinct itself from Somalia . We believe Somaliland has a obligation to rejoin Somalia , the Ethiopian foreign minister says .Seyoum further adds that the Somali nation have a right to use their collective mind to come to a consensus about their destiny . The citizens of Somalia have to use their collective mind and exercise their legitimate right and tell whether Somaliland should stay part of Somalia , in the same way the people of Ethiopia or Djibouti have the same right to remain part of Ethiopia or Djibouti .
translation: Ethiopia claims it does not support the self-proclaimed republic's sovereignty despite its trade ties with the breakaway enclave of Somaliland. Ethiopian Foreign Minister Seyoum Mesfin said Somaliland deserves a chance to improve relations with Somalia. Seyoum spoke at a media briefing in Addis Ababa. We see Somaliland as an integral part of Somalia and do not believe that Somaliland is different from Somalia. "We believe that Somaliland has an obligation to reunite with Somalia," Ethiopia's foreign minister said. Seyoum added that the Somali people have the right to use their collective wisdom to reach a consensus on their destiny. The people of Somalia must collectively exercise their legal rights and ensure that Somaliland remains part of Somalia, just as the people of Ethiopia and Djibouti have the same right to remain part of Ethiopia and Djibouti. have to decide whether or not to do so.

continuation: and demanded cash . " There are people at home .There are communities out there that are concerned for their loved people that are working these businesses that might be a victim . "Williams claimed the attacker used a unique orange and dark ski mask , but could also be shown with sunglasses . Investigators say they were on the lookout for a gray 2003 Ford Ranger pickup , possibly with a plate reading " LAZYT , " a body design usually employed in a pickup truck bed .Williams said
translation:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  Police released photos Wednesday of a vehicle they are searching for in connection with a robbery and shooting at a BP gas station in Arlington.
Detectives said a gunman shot the business owner and demanded cash. "We all worked nonstop. We didn't sleep, we worked all night," Jacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams added at a news conference Thursday. "There are people at home. There's a community that's worried that their loved ones who work in this business could become victims. This could happen anywhere. But we're here in Jacksonville. We are working hard to prevent that from happening. We are looking at every opportunity to make sure this problem is resolved.'' Williams said the culprit is uniquely orange and dark in color. He was wearing a ski mask, but he may also be seen wearing sunglasses. Investigators said they were looking for a gray 2003 Ford Ranger pickup truck, possibly with a plate that reads "LAZYT," a body design commonly found in the bed of pickups. They were looking for a gray 2003 Ford Ranger pickup truck, Williams said.

Friday, the Fourth National Climate Assessment was released. Its a sobering look at the economic and physical effects of climate change in the United States, and where those changes are leading.
At 1,656 pages, the report is massive
continuation: . To assistance you sort through all of the information , our expert science staff dug in and are brought you some highlights from the reports conclusions on our home state of Oregon .Looking specifically at Oregon , the evaluation statement sees that climate change is making Oregons worst wildfires hotter and worse , flooding and drought more serious , and kills and sickens Oregonians . The report also discovered that climate change is hurting the states economy and our well - being .It makes it more expensive to insure our homes and farm lands . Its leading to more losing and destroyed agriculture , animals , and forest products .It hurts health as smoke from wildfires causes more illnesses and depression . And the increased costs to repair damage brought by wildfires , floods , and droughts might soon make Oregon unaffordable to live in .Over the past
translation:
The 4th National Climate Assessment was released on Friday. This is a sobering look at the economic and physical effects of climate change in the United States and where it's headed.
The report is 1,656 pages long. To help you make sense of it all, we've dug into some of the highlights from our scientific expert's report's conclusions for our home state of Oregon. Focusing specifically on Oregon, the assessment report notes that climate change is driving Oregon's largest wildfires. The heat is getting worse, flooding and drought are becoming more severe, and Oregonians are dying and getting sick. The report also says climate change is having a negative impact on the state's economy and our well-being. That makes insurance for our homes and farmlands more expensive. This leads to further loss and destruction of agricultural, animal and forest products. This is harmful to health, as wildfire smoke causes further illness and depression. And the cost of repairing damage from wildfires, floods and droughts will increase and Oregon may soon be unable to pay.

translation:

translation: Infertility is one of the most difficult issues couples face, and many feel that discussing the issue with friends and family will only make the situation worse. A new study finds differences in how men and women share information about infertility. A University of California study found that women are more willing to discuss infertility issues, while men are more likely to use humor to deflect the problem. Infertility is more common than some people think. Approximately 1 in 10 couples in the United States report difficulty conceiving. translation:
What happened in the cockpit of Flight 370?
Former aviation accident investigator Stephen Wallace describes a situation where the flight path was pre-programmed into the computer.
The pilot and co-pilot of the missing plane, both Malaysian nationals, are the subject of an investigation. New information released this weekend reveals that the pilots failed to submit an international flight plan, a routine step required for missions lasting more than five hours. The data also confirmed that the plane had not received any satellite messages since then. The plane is located in the Indian Ocean, about 1,100 miles west of Perth, Australia, according to the missing Australian Joint Agency Coordination Center. The Australian search team said in a report that more than 25 aircraft and 10 ships are currently involved in the search operation, which is expected to expand in the coming weeks.

translation: Part 2: Last week I wrote about Employee A. She was a short-tempered, unproductive woman who had been fired by a client of mine who had just acquired a company. Today we will look at another employee, Employee B, who contributed to disrespectful behavior in the workplace and caused a lot of problems for my client. Ms. B is a large, athletic, sociable woman who is the girlfriend of one of the best salespeople in the company. she is suitable for her job. She is passionate about her sales role, is a natural leader and has great communication skills. Over the years, the company has provided leadership training to improve her skills and become an even stronger leader. Some time after the company acquired the company, Mr. B was asked to join the team overseeing the entire sales organization. This is the best part of my job, she said. "I can't wait to take on this new responsibility!" But after a few years, she started complaining about the management team her manager had assembled. It seemed to her that her team had too many people, information was not being shared, and each manager had a hand pointing at someone when something happened.

input: Ronald Clifton Longe Jr. and Jerome Duane Grant were married Saturday morning at Henrys restaurant in New York. Its owner, Henry Rinehart, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion

Longe , a clerk in the National Park Services science services division , met five years previously while live on the Upper West Side of Manhattan .Mr . Grant , 29 , was born in Brooklyn . translation: Ronald Clifton Long Jr. and Jerome Duane Grant were married Saturday morning at Henry's Restaurant in New York City. The ceremony was presided over by owner Henry Reinhart, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister for the occasion. Mr. Mr. Grant, a United Airlines maintenance worker, and Mr. Long, who works in the National Park Service's scientific services division, met five years ago while living on Manhattan's Upper West Side. Grant, 29, was born in Brooklyn. His father is David Grant, a city clerk in Queens. Long, 28, was born in Richmond, Virginia. Although he currently lives in Washington, D.C., he grew up in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn. His father is Ronald Long, a retired insurance professional. They live in Philadelphia. A version of this article was printed on his 1001035 page in the national edition on April 24, 1994, under the heading ``Men marking men at modern weddings: asking for hands''.

Smoking rates in US have fallen to all-time low, but how did they ever get so high?
(THE CONVERSATION) The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention calls cigarette smoking the leading cause of preventable disease and death
continuation: in the United States , killing more than 480 , 000 persons per year and costing the nation $ 170 billion in direct healthcare costs and $ 156 billion in losing productivity . While its great news that the proportion of people who smoke in the U . S . has reached a historic low of 14 % , tobacco remains to cost lives and money .This is despite a considerable deal of effort devoted to combating smoking through education , taxation and marketing laws . Simply putting , people understand from their experiences and get choices accordingly .In the mid - 1950s , cigarette companies began to realize tobacco as an addiction , mostly owing to the tobacco - machines feet traffic and the quantity of cigarettes people buy . The corporations implemented their advertising tactics on how to impact these decisions , including the creation of logos , product placement
translation:
Smoking rates in the United States have fallen to record lows, but why did they get so high in the first place?

(Conversation) The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention cites smoking as the leading cause of preventable disease and death in the United States, killing more than 480,000 people annually and costing the country $170 billion in direct medical costs and $156 billion in medical expenses. USD. Leads to lost productivity. Although it is good news that the percentage of smokers in the United States has increased. Although the U.S. population has reached a historic low of 14%, tobacco continues to take lives and money. Despite significant efforts to regulate smoking through education, tax, and marketing laws, this has not been achieved. Simply put, people understand this through experience and are given choices accordingly. In the mid-1950s, tobacco companies began to realize that tobacco was addictive, but this was mainly due to the movement of cigarette-making machines and the increase in the number of cigarettes people buy. Companies implement advertising strategies to influence these decisions, including the creation of logos and product placement.

translation:
The former chief of staff is one of more than 100 former officers charged with subversion in 1997.
The former Turkish military commander is on trial in Ankara along with more than 100 other suspects for plotting to overthrow the Turkish government 16 years ago. The case was one of five separate plots investigated by Turkish prosecutors in 1997 for allegedly plotting to overthrow Turkey's secular government. Husnu Ghazi was among 104 former military and police officers who appeared before the State Security Court in Ankara on Tuesday. The plot involved military leaders accused of plotting to blow up important government and military facilities in order to stage a coup in the country. "I haven't read the indictment yet, but the case file is 4,656 pages long," said lawyer Ismail Moussa. "This is a tremendous problem. There is a huge amount of documentation that I have not yet read," he added. in an Anka courtroom early Tuesday morning.

translation:
January 25 - A child is pulled from the rubble in Aleppo as Syria's civil war rivals hold their first face-to-face talks to begin talks aimed at ending nearly three years of conflict. Mana Rabbi reported this.
Syrian rebels meet with a delegation from President Bashar al-Assad's government in Switzerland. The two countries will meet face-to-face for the first time since the civil war began. And back in Syria, the dictatorship is attacking rebel strongholds, including Aleppo. A city that bore the brunt of the invasion. At least six civilians were killed in the attack, witnesses said, and rescue teams searched through the rubble for survivors. The woman was pulled from her wreckage by emergency services. The talks aim to end the Syrian civil war, which has killed 150,000 people and displaced millions. However, opinions on both sides remain divided. "Those who came here want to talk with the opposition, that's all. This is not a negotiation with Bashar, the dictator," Syrian opposition spokesman Ubaye Shabandar told Reuters.

input: Looks like Apple wants a slice of the wearable camera action, based on recently awarded patents. The US Patents and Trademarks Office today awarded the iPhone maker a series of 34 patents, including one that details a GoPro-like action camera system.
continuation: According to the patent , the activity camera would be embedded with a smartwatch . The camera can be configured with a passive element that can serve as a power switch that wakes the camera and starts it off .The camera can be configured with a passive element that can serve as a digital on / off switch that wakes the camera and starts it off , the patent reads . The patent goes on to explain how the wearable cameras would be paired with a smartwatch and linked up to a smartphone via Bluetooth .The smartphone would then be able to screen a number of still photographs , provide editing features and view live video . Obviously , this is just a patent at this point , which means theres no guarantee Apple will actually roll out a GoPro - like device .And theres no telling what the actual device might look like . But its definitely one of the more exciting Apple patents
translation: Apple seems to want a piece of wearable camera based on a recently issued patent. The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office today granted a series of 34 patents to the iPhone maker. Among them are patents detailing GoPro-like action camera systems. According to the patent, the activity camera will be integrated into smartwatches. The camera can be configured with a passive element that acts as a power switch to wake up and start the camera. The camera can be configured with a passive element that acts as a digital on/off switch that wakes the camera from sleep mode and wakes it up. The patent says it's off. The patent also explains how the wearable camera pairs with a smartwatch and connects to a smartphone via Bluetooth. Your smartphone will be able to display multiple photos, provide editing features, and allow you to watch videos in real time. Obviously, this is just a patent at this point, and there's no guarantee that Apple will actually release a device like his GoPro. And it's unclear what the actual device will look like. But this is definitely one of Apple's most interesting patents.

As he came in , he saw the gunman , a male , he shooting him , at which moment the male dropped his gun and was still standing and turned around and shot at the deputy , Ventura County Sheriff Geoff Dean told reporters .The deputy falling and the gunman looked around and , as he was turning around , fired one more round and striking the deputy at which point the deputy fired one more round and wounded the gunman . Dean said the defendants motive remains unsure .The gunman , who was wore military - style gear and
translation:
THOUSAND OAKS, Calif. (RNN) - Less than two weeks after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting that killed 11 people, a new mass shooting in California has left more than a dozen people dead.
On Wednesday afternoon, a gunman killed 12 people, including a sheriff's deputy, at a nightclub in the Southern California city of Thousand Oaks, north of Los Angeles. Among the victims was Ventura County Sheriff's Office veteran Sergeant Ron Health, who responded to a report of shots fired at 11:20 p.m. "When he entered, he saw an armed man firing at him, at which point the man dropped the gun and was still shooting," Ventura County Sheriff Jeff Dean told reporters. "He stood there, turned around and fired at the deputy." The gunman turned around and fired another shot, hitting his deputy, who then fired another shot, hitting the gunman. Dean said the defendant's motive remains unclear.

input: Andrew P. Fitzgerald, 50, formerly of Plattsburgh, N.Y., passed away Tuesday, March 5, 2019, at Sarasota Memorial Hospital with his family by his side. He was born in Plattsburgh, N.Y.,
continuation: May 23, 1968, the son of James F. and Mary (Fleck) Fitzgerald.He attended Clinton High School and graduated in 1986.Andrew then moved on to work at the Plattsburgh International Airport as an Air Traffic Controller . In his spare time , he enjoyed the great outdoors ; fishing , boating , golfing , and spending time with his animals .In 1997 , he took the move to Fort Lauderdale , Fla . There he had the privilege of working as a contractor at Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport .His real desire was his family . In 2016 , Andrew was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer .He fought it with courage and integrity for three years . He left behind his families , James and Mary Fitzgerald ; two sons , Andy

input: My son Kris, an Army Ranger, was one of the first killed in action on October 19, 2001, in Operation Rhino, our first incursion into Afghanistan right after 9/11. Kris had been in Ranger School during that attack on American soil
continuation: , and they were among the first ones sent to Afghanistan.They hadn't even had time to take a shakedown.One morning I was going to the Capitol and I put on the radio in my vehicle and listened to it as I drove . The president was talking .I walked to the floor of the House , and when we adjourned the bodies came in , walked down the hall , and we saw a man who was obviously very upset , and it turned out to be Dick Cheney . We went into a back room and he said , " I want to told you about my sister Liz , who was working at the World Trade Center , and how she gets away from there and her second brother was in the Pentagon when the aircraft came into it .So we ' re very concerned about how you people in Congress are going to support the president . " I was utterly shocked .I mean , Dick
translation: My son, Chris, an Army Ranger, was one of the first to be killed in action on October 19, 2001, during Operation Rhino, the first invasion of Afghanistan in the immediate aftermath of 9/11. Chris attended Ranger School during the attack on American soil and was one of the first to be sent to Afghanistan. They didn't even have time to retrain. One morning, as I was getting ready to go to the Capitol, I turned on the radio. I was listening to it in the car while driving. the president spoke. I walked to the floor of the House, and during the adjournment, the body came in, and I walked down the hallway, and I saw a man who was obviously very upset. It turned out to be Dick Cheney. We went into the back room and he said, "I want to talk about her sister Liz, who worked at the World Trade Center, and how she escaped from there, but when the plane arrived, her other brother went to the Pentagon. "This." So we are very concerned about how you in Congress will support the president. I mean, Dick.

input: (Leah Hogsten | The Salt Lake Tribune) Derek Miller, right, president and CEO of the Salt Lake Chamber, passes a pen to the city's business and civic leaders who gathered Thursday to sign the Utah Compact, initially adopted in 2010.
continuation: Salt Lake City , Jan . 11 , 2018 . By Benjamin Wood | The Salt Lake Tribune Salt Lake City representatives have reaffirmed their engagement to immigration and asylum policy with a formal restatement of a compact originally ratified five years previously .The Utah Compact is a document that details Salt Lake Citys goals regarding immigration and asylum policy . It was originally signed in 2010 in reaction to a resolution that passed the Utah State Legislature that directed the Utah Board of Regents to prioritize those with an immediate family member still residing in the state .During a media conference on Thursday , Salt Lake City Mayor Jackie Biskupski said that while the original compact has largely remained the same , she believes it will be a call to action to support migrants resettlement . The compact was signed
translation: (Leah Hogsten | Salt Lake Tribune) Salt Lake City Council President and CEO Derek Miller (right) gathered Thursday to sign the Utah Compact, which was first adopted in 2010. He handed the pen to the city's business and civic leaders. Salt Lake City, January 11, 2018. By Benjamin Wood | Salt Lake Tribune Salt Lake City reaffirmed its commitment to immigration and asylum policy by formally reaffirming a treaty originally ratified five years ago. The Utah Compact is a document that details Salt Lake City's goals regarding immigration and asylum policy. The bill was originally signed into law in 2010 in response to a resolution passed by the Utah State Legislature. The resolution directed the Utah Board of Regents to prioritize those with immediate family members still living in the state. Salt Lake City Mayor Jackie Biskupski said at a news conference Thursday that while much of the original agreement remains unchanged, she believes it is a call to action to help resettle immigrants. agreement was signed

Justin Holiday may be the next breakout story.
Now a mainstay in the NBA, Holiday is seeing a

J .now operates a community center in Mesa , Ariz . , and loves taught kids what it means to be a better athlete and a better boy . Justin Holiday could be next to break out.

translation: From the outside, the 2019 Honda Pilot looks like any other modern SUV. It has the ground clearance and space to convince Americans to ditch their cars and buy larger ones, and like any other segment, it fits there. In fact, the Pilot has maintained this look for several years, with some minor trim updates and a redesigned front fascia for 2016. But what makes the Pilot special is its powertrain. It's still a little strange to see a Honda car with a big V6 engine and a 9-speed automatic transmission, but they complement each other well. All in all, this is an incredibly comfortable SUV that will suit most parents' needs. The Honda Pilot shares much of its design language with the Honda Ridgeline. The Pilot has the profile of a more mainstream SUV, while the Ridgeline has the higher seating position and mattress features of an SUV, as well as the drivetrain of a car. Both cars are scheduled to be updated in 2016, and although it is two years late, the Pilot will be updated in 2016.

Two degrees that a year earlier might not have qualified as having high revenues now sit in the top 1

input:
QUITO, ECUADOREcuador election officials have agreed to recount nearly 1.3 million votes as opposition leader Guillermo Lasso continues to allege fraud in the presidential election.
The National Electoral Council announced late Thursday it would
continuation: recount 1 , 280 , 205 votes from the April 11 runoff , about 1 . 6 % of all voting cast . Lasso , who says the election was not credible , has filed a petition for a complete recount of all ballots .He affirmed his losing but has not conceded the election . President Lenin Moreno defeated Lasso by 51 . 1 % to 48 . 9 % in the runoff .Thursdays recount results are expected to be released Friday .
translation:
QUITO, ECUADOR Ecuador's electoral authorities have agreed to a recount of about 1.3 million votes as opposition leader Guillermo Lasso continues to allege fraud in the presidential election.
The National Electoral Commission announced late Thursday that it would recount 1,280,205 votes from the April 11 runoff, about 1.5 times as many as 6% of the total number of voters. Lasso argued that the election was not credible and demanded a full recount of all ballots. He conceded defeat but did not accept the election results. President Lenin Moreno defeated Lasso by 51 points, 1% to 48, and 90% in the second round. The results of Thursday's recount are expected to be announced on Friday.

translation:
Lee, 45, is an avid jogger and has been jogging almost every day for the past five years. She recently started having pain in her knees.

To celebrate the 2018 FIFA World Cup, the Telstar 18 features an augmented reality Snapchat filter and is the first official ball to feature digital graphics on its surface. The ball combines a typical panel shape, high gloss varnish and a modern hexagonal design. Using the official match ball as a canvas, Telstar 18 invites soccer fans around the world to unleash their creativity and take part in a virtual game of street football. Soccer fans have the chance to win a spot in the latest Adidas tournament for 2018. # MadeForPlay Street Football Challenge: Create creative videos using Telstar 18 and share them via Snapchat, social media, or your own content. Players will be asked to share their videos.

translation:
Driverless buses and other city vehicles will soon follow the path of a pioneering self-driving shuttle between the Calgary Zoo and Terrace Spark, city councilors announced Thursday.
The 12-seater Electronic Autonomous Shuttle (E-AV) is an electric vehicle and will be the first fully autonomous vehicle to operate on Calgary's roads and highways. Councilor Evan Spencer says cities can embrace on-demand transportation by reducing emissions, increasing transit access, reducing public transit wait times, and making transit more accessible to residents. He said he would be able to provide it. His E-AV testing in the Eau Claire market and Terrace-Sparks corridor will improve the safety and feasibility of unmanned shuttles in Calgary. We will continue to work with residents to educate them about traffic safety issues, Spencer said. He said Calgary's transit service costs $135 million a month, and operating costs have increased by nearly 50 per cent over the past decade.

translation:

It is proposed for consideration by the Senate Committee on Commerce and Technology, chaired by the senator. Brant Hirschman (right). translation:

In Nairobi's neatly landscaped gardens, Joash Okindo hobbles toward a marble memorial erected in memory of those killed in the 1998 bombing of the U.S. embassy. Most of the dead were Kenyans on their way to work in the morning, others were children playing on the side of the highway or just bystanders. That day, al-Qaeda terrorists led by American citizen Fazle Abdullah Mohammed rammed a bomb-laden truck and attacked the ambassador. The explosion destroyed a three-story building, killed 213 people, tore through a nearby road and injured dozens. Oquindo, 52, was on the opposite side of the highway when his pickup truck exploded. "It was like a lightning strike, like a huge bomb," he recalls.

translation:
Daniel R. Welsh, 60, of Williamsfield, Ohio, passed away Sunday, October 20, 2013, at his home.
Born March 22, 1953 in Pittsburgh, the son of Shirley L. (Gregory) Vidnich of Aliquil, Ohio, and the late John M. Vidnich, Daniel worked for the Ottawa Electric Cooperative. Daniel married Margaret H. (McGowan) of Wales on June 6, 1981 at Williams Field. He was a member of the Williams Field Free and Accepted Masons. In addition to his grandfather, survivors include his wife of 32 years, Margaret Welsh, Williamsfield; son and son-in-law Daniel and Don Welsh, Genoa, Ohio; son and son-in-law, Erin and Jake Shieldgen, Tiffin, Ohio; two granddaughters, Eva Welsh and Taylor Welsh; brother and sister-in-law, Robert and Patricia Widnick, Alikill, Ohio; and two brothers, Brenda Goh.

translation:
A narrow road to the compound, the temporary residence of American officials, remained blocked off by security guards. A security official said an "important private event" was taking place there.
Both sides are in Singapore, apparently to discuss the logistical details of high-level talks. In June, President Trump met with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un in Singapore, an unprecedented face-to-face meeting between a U.S. president and a North Korean leader. The United States has made it clear that it is willing to hold a second meeting with Kim. However, the location and specific dates of follow-up were not established. A senior U.S. official said North Korean officials usually stay in luxury hotels, but this time they chose "a more modest home." The complex is inhabited by North Koreans and is often rented out to foreign dignitaries and diplomats. The U.S. delegation attending the meeting includes U.S. Special Representative for North Korea Stephen Biegun, Deputy Secretary of State John Sullivan, and Deputy Secretary of Defense Patrick Shanahan. Reuters reported in July that President Trump asked his advisers if he could make a surprise visit to North Korea.

translation:
This is a great movie idea. Tropic Thunder is set on the set of a big-budget Hollywood Vietnam War movie (also known as Tropic Thunder).
Filming is delayed endlessly due to a difficult cast, so the studio orders the film to go forward with or without acting. In desperation, the director offers the actors a $100,000 bonus and a Golden Globe Award if they complete the shoot. However, the studio requires actors to have makeup and acting skills to play Vietnam veterans. The director commits suicide trying to secure his actors' roles, and the veterans lose their counterfeit bills. In response, actors abandon their trailers and sets and retreat into themselves. From this point on, the film becomes a race between the veterans trying to get back to the safety of the studio. They are searching for a missing actor, as well as drug dealers, criminals, and a roving group of aliens. Along the way, their mission is complicated by self-deception, miscalculation, heartbreak, and parts beyond their control.

Starting with a small rental development where youre adding one
continuation: to three homes to a property , its less risky than a greater development . For instance , rather than building a 40 - unit apartment complex , consider purchasing a commercial property with the possibilities to rehab some of the units into apartments .With these assets , theres fewer hazard , but theres also less financial reward . To create money , the risk wants to be just right .An simpler way to build a rental property portfolio is to began with an individual unit and begin from there . For instance , rather than looking at 40 - unit apartment buildings , consider purchasing a house and converting it to a duplex or a triplex , which can be done without a lot of upfront investment or administration .In this article we explain how to buy your first home and kept your finances in form while doing so . Learn about how to getting a mortgage , why the time to buy is now and why bu
translation:
We all know that real estate developers can earn a lot of money. They also take significant risks. How can family real estate investors get in on the development game?
Starting with a small rental property and adding one to three homes to it is less risky than building a large development. For example, instead of building a 40-unit complex, consider purchasing a commercial property with an option to convert some units to apartments. These assets carry less risk, but also less financial reward. In order to make money, the risk must be appropriate. An easy way to build a rental property portfolio is to start with one unit and work your way up from there. For example, instead of considering 40 apartments, consider buying a house and converting it into a duplex or triplex. This can be done without significant up-front investment or administrative costs. This article explains how to buy your first home. Return home with your household finances in order. Find out how to get a mortgage, why now is the time to buy, and why now is a better time to buy.

The 2017 Pro Bowler has been out all season because of a foot injury and hadnt attempted to practice since early
continuation: September . But he was back in pads and stretching out his lower torso in front of his players Wednesday morning .Bosa made a positive first impression on his first morning back . But Wednesday morning, he returned to pads and stretched out his lower body in front of the players. On the first morning, Botha made a good impression. When Bosa took the field for his first stretch workout in two months, running back Austin Ekeler jumped a few feet and had a big smile on his face. After Bosa ended, the defensive line especially exploded. Several more Chargers returned from long-term injuries this season. Shaq Barrett will make his Bucks debut after Week 10. Freshman Brandon Allen, who played QB at Arkansas and Western Kentucky, made his first career start in Week 8 and played well.

Stearns, a doctor and avid skier, died in December 2015 after being shot by a machine gun at his hunting lodge. He is survived by his wife and son, who was 10 years old at the time, and who is now doing well. I named it after Brett because he was a big, strong guy who always encouraged others to do their best.

translation:
SALT LAKE CITY Evan McMullin sat at a conference table in his modest campaign headquarters one morning last week, trying to pick the most disappointing top Republican senator this year.
"Can I just say 'all of the above'?" he paused and said with a groan. McMullin is a presidential candidate in the most impossible of races: a self-described conservative independent running against Donald Trump. In an effort to prevent a Republican candidate from taking the White House, Mr. Trump is doing everything he can to make Mr. McMullin irrelevant. He attempted to broadcast his message on television in Salt Lake City and other western states, even though his small party could barely pay the rent. Even more frustrating, he says, is that few Republican voters are willing to support Trump. Voters like Ted Cruz and Ben Carson dominated this market. Many people have already announced that they will not vote for him.

translation:
(JTA) The five people killed in a truck ramming attack in New York City on Tuesday afternoon included Argentine tourists celebrating their 30th anniversary of high school graduation and a Jewish businessman.
Three of the dead were girls, Argentina's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said. All the victims are young people. His Jewish name is Daniel Castro. He was one of more than 20 men injured in the incident. His wife and one-year-old child, whose name has not been released, were also injured. Jewish groups expressed sadness over Castro's death, adding that Argentine Jews and others would hold a prayer vigil for the victims. Among those who prayed for Castro was his brother Eduardo Castro, who is not Jewish and lives in New York. Eduardo Castro, who has known Daniel Castro since childhood, told a local Argentine radio station that the last time he spoke to him was about two weeks ago, when his sister told him about his family's plans to travel to Florida. The extent of GOP efforts to prevent black people and Latinos from voting is jaw-dropping. And this Nov. 8, minority voters need to document it so America can see.
Donald Trumps offensive statements and the chaos theyve
continuation: spawned have finally thrown outrage over the Republican Partys abuse of voter suppression to the top of the news . The extent of GOP programs to keep colored folks and Latinos from votes is jaw - dropping .This past year and a half , Republican state legislatures have passed more laws to prohibit access to the polls than in any year since the Voting Rights Act becoming legal in 1965 , notes the National Urban League , one of the countrys major civil rights organisations . We are currently living through one of the darkest chapters in American history .Yet the disgraceful underbelly of American history is still overlooked by many non - voters . The NAACPs This Is Not Normal campaign and former Barack Obama campaign manager , David Plouffe , are attempting to re - energize voter organizations that have disengaged
translation:
The scale of the Republican effort to stop blacks and Latinos from voting is staggering. And on November 8, minority voters should document it so America can see.

Donald Trump's aggressive rhetoric and the chaos it has caused have finally brought anger over the Republican abuse of voter suppression to the top of the news. The scope of the Republican policy to stop people of color and Latinos from voting is staggering. Over the past year and a half, Republican state legislatures have passed more laws banning access to polling places than any other year since the Voting Rights Act was legalized in the United States. In 1965, the National Urban League, one of the largest civil rights organizations in the country, points out. We are currently experiencing one of the darkest chapters in American history. But the shameful underbelly of American history continues to be ignored by many non-voters. The NAACP's "This Is Not Normal" campaign and former Barack Obama campaign chairman David Plouffe are trying to breathe new life into the organization of voters who no longer show up to the polls.

translation:
When Hayley Talbot arrived at Whiting Beach in her corflute kayak this morning, there was a lot of applause and a few tears.
She swam 1000 kilometers from Taree, Queensland, and when she reached shore, she raised her paddle into the air with a "happy" sound. Its just incredible, she said with a smile. She plans to join the Gold Coast wave once it arrives. She will arrive on the coast in about two weeks. Taree Paddlers ended their 2018 adventure in Port Macquarie yesterday, after stopping at several coastal towns along the way. Haley was the youngest rower in the group and her one of two girls who participated in the adventure. The third person, Tanya Crawford, was not a rower this time, but a passenger. The band was dressed from head to toe, looking exhausted and ready for a well-deserved break. Today they were looking forward to pampering themselves with a spa and massage. They will soon be spending a few days in Port Macquarie.

Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings, the new chairman of the House

Zoe Lofgren , D - Calif . , John Conyers , D - Mich . , Louise Slaughter , D - N . Y . , and Debbie Wasserman Schultz , D - Fla . " Every American has the right to expect that their government operates with sincerity and integrity , and that their elected officials serve the public interest , not their own interests

House Democrats on Friday announced a comprehensive package of election and ethics reforms aimed at addressing what they called "Washington's culture of corruption" and reducing the role of money in politics.
Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings, the new chairman of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, said her goal is to develop high ethical standards and practices in Congress and to "adhere to the American ideals of honesty and integrity." be sure to follow the guidelines.'' The bill aims to reduce "lobbying abuse" and increase transparency in federal elections, including ending general election funding matching projects and disclosing donors in ads. In addition to Mr. Cummings, other prominent members of Congress who support the bill include members of the House of Representatives. Zoe Lofgren, a Democrat from California. , John Conyers, Democrat - Michigan. , Louise Slaughter, D-N. Yu and Debbie Wasserman Schultz, Democrat of Florida. All Americans have the right to expect their government to act with honesty and integrity and that their elected officials serve the public interest, not self-interest.

continuation: old , and Arcadius , ninea huge and increasingly ungovernable Empire that was also in the throes of disintegration . The attack of Persian armies through the Roman Empire of the Eastern Roman ( Byzantine ) Empire began in 363 with an incursion into Mesopotamia under Shapur I .In 364 Shapur began to negotiate with the Roman Emperor Julian for the return of several Persian prisoners , and when this was rejected Shapur ordered his forces to invasion Syria , capturing Antioch ,
translation:
The Roman Empire took only 80 years to collapse as a political entity.
When Theodosius the Great died in his year 395, he bequeathed to his two helpless sons, 10-year-old Honorius and Arcadius, a vast and increasingly ungovernable empire, which also It was on the verge of collapse. Barbarian tribes from the north had already invaded the Balkans and parts of Western Europe, but a far more serious challenge came from Rome's archenemies, the Persians. By the end of the fourth millennium, the Sassanids were under the rule of Ardashir I, a talented and ambitious Persian monarch. Persian attacks on the territories of the Eastern Roman (Byzantine) Empire began in 363 with Shapur I's invasion of Mesopotamia. In 364, Shapur began negotiations with the Roman Emperor Julian for the return of several Persian captives. The offer was rejected. Shapur ordered his army to invade Syria and capture Antioch.

Speaking after a meeting with the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, Bush
continuation: said he was eager to secure a lasting reconciliation for Israelis and Palestinians . The Israeli prime secretary , Ehud Olmert , appreciated Bush ' s personal initiatives to broker a agreement ." These two months , I was not certain that this might be achieved in these two months , but now , for the first time , we have an environment of hope and trust between Israel and the Palestinians , " Olmert stated . Abbas said he believed Bush ' s initiative might end Israel ' s occupation , develop a Palestinian state with Jerusalem as its capital , and
translation:

After speaking with Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, President Bush said he is committed to ensuring a lasting settlement between Israelis and Palestinians. President Bush and Prime Minister Abbas met for more than an hour to discuss efforts to restart negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians after a two-month hiatus. said the official. Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert praised Mr. Bush's personal efforts to reach a deal. ``Hope and trust between Israelis and Palestinians,'' Olmert said. Mr. Abbas, on Mr. Bush's initiative, ended the Israeli occupation and established a Palestinian state with Jerusalem as its capital.

translation:

Stated. The contraceptive mandate, which would require religious nonprofits and businesses affiliated with religion to cover contraception at no out-of-pocket cost, was scheduled to take effect Tuesday. On Friday, the Supreme Court ruled in favor of employers who are morally opposed to contraception. Provides insurance for contraception. continuation: can miss early changes in the retina . A bright line in the eye , known a lesion , is a classic indication of an early eye disease , he said , but scanners cannot catch up the tiny lesions that might lead to earlier vision failure .Sarunic stated his scanner should be able to diagnose lesions as small as 15 micrometers in width , whereas modern scanners recognize lesions as big as 150 micrometers . Dr . James Marsh of the University of Montreal Health Center said his scanner is at least 10 times faster than conventional ones and can even view tumours in the eye .He said that Sarunics machine will decrease the time and expense of eye scans .
translation:
A British Columbia engineering professor says he has developed a high-resolution scanner that could revolutionize the diagnosis of eye diseases and prevent vision loss.
Simon Fraser University professor Marinko Sarni said the low-resolution scanners currently used by doctors could miss early changes in the retina. Bright lines on the eye, called lesions, are a typical sign of early eye disease, but scanners cannot detect smaller lesions that can lead to early vision loss, he said. Salnik said the scanner should be able to diagnose the lesions. Its width is only 15 micrometers, but modern scanners recognize lesions up to 150 micrometers in size. doctor. James Marsh of the University of Montreal Health Center said his scanner is at least 10 times faster than traditional scanners and can even see tumors inside the eye. He said Salnik's machine would reduce the time and cost of eye scans.

translation:
Mr. Beaumont decided to do something formally about this important but decidedly First World problem.
Rightly or not, millennials are being blamed for a lot of things, including the slow decline of mainstream beer. Labeled as everything from picky to lazy to entitled, this group is often accused of downplaying the value of classic tastes in favor of trendy options. From big breweries to nanobreweries, companies are trying to attract millennials, but no one seems to have a clear idea of how to do it. Beaumont is trying to do just that. Beaumont he purchased three variations, each priced around 4.5% (4 by volume). 5 calories per ounce, 110 calories per bottle. The most popular fruit flavor is lemonade, and seasonal 4-packs such as watermelon and peach are also available. In terms of strength, you have to go all the way back to 1992 to find a packaged ale with the same level of calorie restriction as Heineken's Premium Light (99 calories).

input: SPRINGFIELD -- The Department of Children and Family Services began issuing layoff notices to 600 employees on Friday with the aim of paring its workforce by 375 positions while still meeting its legal obligations to care for abused and neglected children and provide other services
continuation: , agency representatives said . And more layoffs will occur , said Brenda Bass , the agency ' s chief deputy director of field activities ." These layoffs are going to be a slow process , " she said . The 600 workers at the South Fillmore Street agency and in 13 regional headquarters across the state were offered the ability to take early retirement or voluntary transfers as well as have their jobs removed through layoffs .Some of the workers accepted the offers and some refused , a spokeswoman said . The department has one of the greatest workforces in state administration , with more than 6 , 600 employees , and has grown substantially over the previous few years .The cuts will trim the total workforce by about 5 percent . Gov .Rod Blagojevich used government stimulus funding to escape layoffs in
translation: SPRINGFIELD  The Department of Children and Families on Friday issued layoff notices to 600 employees, reducing its workforce by 375 while meeting its legal obligation to provide care and other services to abused and neglected children. Officials said that they have begun sending them. . And there will be more layoffs, said Brenda Bass, the agency's principal deputy director for field operations. "These reductions will be a slow process," she said. The 600 employees at the South Fillmore Street agency and 13 regional headquarters across the state were given the option of early retirement, voluntary transfer or separation through layoffs. Some workers accepted the offer, while others rejected it. said the spokesperson. The department is one of the largest staffed departments in state government, with over 6,600 employees and has grown significantly in recent years. Due to the layoffs, the overall workforce will be reduced by approximately 5%. Gov. Rod Blagojevich used state stimulus funds to avoid layoffs in the state.
