translation: Analysis: The Prime Minister was a media darling in New York, but at home the Opposition stepped up attacks over the Meka Whaitiri affair and hounded his Ministers over the Derek Handley emails. Peter Wilson reflects on a busy week in Parliament. When Jacinda Ardern first became Prime Minister, The New York Times hailed her as a breath of fresh air - "bursting with enthusiasm" and "the Minister we want". A perceived culture of political correctness that, according to foreign newspapers, hushed up the facts. This week, world media reported that 12 new members had been appointed to the Executive Committee of the Security Council, the most powerful organ of the United Nations dealing with global issues bigger than the dairy crisis or student loans. This meant that the Prime Minister had no domestic constituency. She was on the shortlist for the Prime Minister's office in Riwaka, at least until Te Tai Tonga MP Rino Tirikatene filed a complaint.

input: Father of the Nation' is an honorific bestowed on individuals who are considered the most important in the process of the establishment of a country or a nation. They are instrumental in the birth of their nations by way of liberating them from colonial or other occupation
continuation: or by way of establishing an independent and sovereign nation - nation . The terms Father of the Nation or Mother of the Nation have become a part of popular political terminology and sometimes employed in Asia and Africa .They are often employed as patriotic rhetoric and modeled after Indian Nationalist Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi , the Father of the Nation , but is also associated with South Korean president Syngman Rhee and Israeli political president David Ben - Gurion . More generally , the term is often employed by states as a patriotic term of honor and is modeled after Soviet president Joseph Stalin .It is also used to commemorate nationalist communist leaders who are regarded as " founding fathers " of the state . Most nations have a specific " Father of the Nation " or " Mother of the Nation " .This page contains text from Wikipedia, the Free Encyclopedia - https://wn.com/F
translation: "Founding Father" is an honorary title given to the person considered most important in the process of forming a country or nation. They contribute to the birth of nations, either by liberating them from colonial or other occupation or by creating independent, sovereign nation-states. The terms "Father of the Nation" or "Mother of the Nation" have become part of the common political vocabulary and are sometimes used in Asia and Africa. These are often used as patriotic rhetoric and are modeled after Indian nationalist and founding father Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, but also associated with South Korean President Syngman Rhee and Israeli political president David Ben-Gurion. It is being More generally, the term is often used by nations as a patriotic term of honor, and is modeled after Soviet President Joseph Stalin. It is also used to refer to nationalist communist leaders who are considered the "founding fathers" of a nation. Most countries have a particular "Father of the Nation" or "Mother of the Nation." This page contains text from Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia - https://wn.com/F.

translation:
The Green Bay Packers and Minnesota Vikings were tied 29-29 after a whirlwind drive and overtime.
The Packers appeared to have the game-clinching interception in the fourth quarter, but the play was called off due to a Clay Matthews penalty for tripping Riley Reiff. Instead, the Vikings scored the game-winning touchdown with a Hail Mary pass late in regulation, a play the NFL called one of the most amazing passing plays in NFL history. But in the end, the Packers successfully punted. It happened at Lambeau Field, passing by the feet of Mason Crosby. Green Bay needed one more point, but the Vikings were shut down by Jake Ryan's two-point conversion. All 22. OPINION: Packers defenseman Rodgers is tearing apart the Vikings D.

input: A classic British memoir gets the full costume drama treatment with this beautifully crafted World War I drama, although it never quite transcends the "beloved book" tone, remaining so worthy that it only rarely springs to life. The acting is sharp, as
continuation: are the costumes and setting , and there ' s a vivid story and riveting storyline that effectively depicts the early portion of the wartime and some of the main characters who living through it . But by the end , the filmmakers struggle to make something more out of the narrative .Based on the 1932 autobiography by Canadian Mary Borden , the film recounts how her initiatives to bring German soldiers from World War I as hostages of war back to England helped alter the war ' s outcome and became a major cause in the early 20th century . Its messages might be melodramatic but they ' re also important and moving , and the portrait of the women in the Allied battle effort is a treasure .It ' s a shame that it rarely quite comes to life in the manner that its beautiful and passionate aspects promise . Young Anne ( Kiera Knightley ) arrives in London in 191
translation: This classic British memoir gets the full costume drama treatment in this beautifully crafted World War I drama, but it never fully transcends the confines of a "beloved book." It only happens once in a while because it is so valuable. The acting is excellent, as are the costumes and settings, and the strong story and engaging storyline effectively depict the beginning of the war and some of the main characters who lived through it. But in the end, the filmmakers struggle to make more of the story. Based on Canadian Mary Borden's 1932 autobiography, the film depicts how her efforts to bring German soldiers from World War I back to Britain as war hostages helped change the situation. ing. It was a result of war and became the main cause in the early 20th century. His message may be melodramatic, but it's also important and moving, and his portraits of women who served in Allied combat are a treasure. It's a shame that as beautiful and passionate aspects are promised, they almost never become reality. . In 191, young Anne (Keira Knightley) arrives in London.

input: ISLAMABAD, Oct 27 (APP): Minister for Finance Senator Muhammad Ishaq Dar Thursday said that due to prudent economic policies of the government, macro economic stability has been achieved and now focus was on the sustainable economic growth for job creation
continuation: and alleviation of poverty . The finance minister was chatting to a delegation of Association of Professionals of Pakistan which called on him here .He said that present government had inherited an economy on the verge of default , additionally impacted by an unprecedented energy situation which was now settled . He said Pakistan has been witnessing unprecedented security climate which was also contributing to economic increase as investment was declining .He said that the development of the economy has picked up , inflation rate dropped , production of steel , electricity , gas and cotton rose to unprecedented level , countrys liquid foreign deposits increased to over $ 20 billion . He added that according to IMF , average growth of Pakistan during final five months was seven percent and it remained constant during 2015 - 16 as well .Senator Ishaq Dar said that cabinet is working
translation: ISLAMABAD, Oct 27 (APP): Senate Finance Minister Mohammad Ishaq Dar said on Thursday that macroeconomic stability has been achieved thanks to the government's sound economic policies and now there is a sustained drive to create jobs and fight poverty. He said the focus is on possible economic growth. The finance minister was talking to a delegation of Pakistan Professional Association who visited here. He said the current government inherited an economy on the verge of default and further affected by an unprecedented energy situation, which has now been resolved. He said Pakistan is experiencing an unprecedented security environment, which is also boosting economic growth while investments are declining. He said economic development has accelerated, inflation has declined and steel, electricity, gas and cotton production has increased to unprecedented levels. The country's foreign liquid deposits increased to more than $20 billion. He added that according to the IMF, Pakistan's average growth rate in the past five months was 7% and remained constant during 2015-16. Senator Ishaq Dar said the cabinet is functioning.

input:
ANKARA (Reuters) - For all of Irans fierce verbal response to fresh U.S. threats of tougher sanctions, some senior officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy should stay open.
On Monday, U.S. Secretary
continuation: of State Rex Tillerson said Iran had failed to fulfil the spirit of the atomic deal , and called on all nations to be vigilant in preventing Iran from gaining a atomic weapon . But in Tehran , top diplomats expressed they hope Washington would pull away from President Donald Trumps threats , and pursue to extend the atomic deal , something Iran has so far declined to do .We have often said that if the U . S . would abide by the letter of the nuclear deal and would not harm its interests by sanctions , it would be our natural preference to keep the deal , said one senior Iranian official . The official , talking on condition of anonymity , said Iranian representatives were also worried that Trump , a longtime critic of the atomic deal , might end up destroying it up after Fridays deadline for the European Union to sign off on fresh sanctions
translation:
ANKARA (Reuters) - Despite Iran's strong verbal response to new U.S. threats to tighten sanctions, some senior officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy must remain open.

U.S. Secretary of State Rex Tillerson said on Monday that Iran was not adhering to the spirit of the nuclear deal and called on all countries to be vigilant to prevent Tehran from acquiring nuclear weapons. But in Tehran, senior diplomats expressed hope that the United States would distance itself from President Donald Trump's threats and push for an extension of the nuclear deal, which Iran has so far rejected. Since Iran adheres to the letter of the deal and will not let sanctions harm its interests, staying in the pact would be the obvious choice, the Iranian official said. The official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said Iranian officials were also concerned that Trump, a longtime critic of the nuclear deal, could abandon it after Friday's European Union deadline for signing new sanctions.

input: The belief that there is an Islamic military group that is friendly and another that is evil is a pure myth. All Islamic organizations we see today, from Afghanistan to Algeria and Nigeria, are hostile and subscribe to a takfirist ideology (which
continuation: means they are intolerant of anyone non - Muslim and pursue the worlds domination under Islamic rule ) . There are no exceptions .There are no friendly organizations , and never have been . This is because the history of Islam taught that the fight is not between Muslims and the infidel ; the fight is between Muslims and Muslims who argue with the more extreme segment of Islam .Let us begin with Afghanistan . Today , Pakistans Taqiya Islamist party is referred to as the Taliban .In a sense , they have been in control of the nation for decades now . However , some Islamic militant organisations in Pakistan oppose the Taliban .In Afghanistan , most of those terrorist organizations opposition the Taliban , but all Islamic groups in both country are still Muslims . The only reason for the divisions within Islam is because they believe one group has betrayed the Muslims by either
translation: The idea that there are friendly and evil Islamic military groups is a complete myth. From Afghanistan to Algeria to Nigeria, all Islamic organizations we see today are hostile and espouse takfir ideology (i.e., intolerant and intolerant of all non-Muslims). , seeking world domination under Islamic rule). There are no exceptions. There is no friendly organization, and there never has been. Because Islamic history teaches that the struggle is not between Muslims and infidels. This struggle is between Muslims and those who advocate the more radical parts of Islam. Let's start with Afghanistan. Pakistan's Islamist Taqiyya Party is now known as the Taliban. In a sense, they have ruled the country for decades. However, some Islamic extremist groups in Pakistan oppose the Taliban. In Afghanistan, most of these terrorist organizations are enemies of the Taliban, but Islamic groups in both countries remain Muslim. The only reason for division within Islam is the belief that one group has betrayed Muslims.

According to Fox 35, 67-year-old Joseph Hanson was walking last
continuation: week in Birmingham , Alabama , when he was attacked . Police said he was knocked down and his French bulldog mix service pet , Abu , was confiscated .The retired Navy commander was taken to the hospital , where he later passed away . Hansons daughter , Brandi , said the emotional toll of losing her father is compounded by the losing of Abu .Im heartbroken , she said . I dont sure how Im going to make it .Hanson was in the last year of his life when he was attacked and stealing from , but that was not what killed him . While he was hospitalized , his family says he had heart surgery .
translation:
KISSIMMEE, Fla. (WSVN) - A Vietnam War veteran died before being reunited with his beloved service dog that was stolen from him.
According to Fox 35, Joseph Hanson, 67, was attacked last week while walking in Birmingham, Alabama. Police said the man was thrown to the ground and his pet French bulldog, Abu, was also seized. The retired Navy commander was taken to a hospital where he later died. Hanson's daughter Brandi said the emotional strain on her from losing her father was compounded by the loss of Abu, she said. I am heartbroken, she said. I don't know what to do. Mr. Hanson was assaulted and robbed in the last year of his life, but it did not take his life. His family said he underwent heart surgery while hospitalized.

input: UPPER EAST SIDE  The Second Avenue subway blast that sprayed debris high into the air above 72nd street was sparked by an underground explosion the force of which hit a steel plate covering the work site at street level, the MTA revealed Wednesday.
continuation: The blast came from an underground explosion at around 10 : 30 a . m . that damaged a portion of the train ' s foundation , MTA spokesman Aaron Donovan added . " It seems clear the source was a utility vent box located on 72nd road which has recently been replaced .That ' s why we do the utility box inspections , " Donovan replied . " There ' s no evidence this was a planned or deliberate act . "The utility vents are used to channel water away from the subway tunnels . Donovan said there are a variety of utility vents at the 72nd Street station location , and that they will be inspected by cities and state agencies to ensure everything was faulty .Cops say an MTA worker was hurt by flying debris and took to Roosevelt Hospital , where he was treated
translation: UPPER EAST SIDE The Second Avenue subway explosion that sent debris flying into the air above 72nd Street was caused by an underground explosion whose force struck steel plates covering the work area at street level, the MTA said. It was announced on Wednesday. The explosion occurred in the basement around 10:30 a.m. m. This caused some damage to the train's foundation, MTA spokesman Aaron Donovan added. "It's clear that the source is the recently replaced vent box along Highway 72, which is why we're inspecting the junction box," Donovan responded. "There is no evidence that this was a planned or intentional act."Ventilation ducts are used to drain water from subway tunnels, Donovan said.The 72nd Street station has multiple vents. , said it would be inspected by city and government agencies to make sure everything was in order. Police said an MTA employee was injured by flying debris and was taken to Roosevelt Hospital for treatment.

input:
GREENSBURG, Ind. An Indiana man is facing a murder charge after allegedly admitting to killing his girlfriend.
Jason Eaton, 43, walked into the Greensburg Police Department on Tuesday with a woman and asked to talk to an officer. He
continuation: told them he had killed his girlfriend , Shannon Warner , 40 , last weekend , according to WTHR . Eaton apparently called 911 on Saturday , said he found Warner hanging in the basement of their Greensburg residence .But an autopsy showed Warner was shooting several twice . Eaton was indicted and convicted with murder .The crime is the sixth homicide in the Greensburg area since last October .
translation:
GREENSBURG, Ind. An Indiana man is facing murder charges after he allegedly confessed to killing his girlfriend.
Jason Eaton, 43, entered the Greensburg Police Department Tuesday with a woman and asked to speak to officers. Last weekend, he confessed to killing his girlfriend, Shannon Warner, 40, according to WTHR. Eaton called 911 on Saturday and said he found Warner hanging in the basement of his home in Greensburg, police said. However, an autopsy revealed that Warner shot several people twice. Eaton was charged with murder and convicted. The crime was the sixth homicide in the Greensburg area since October of last year.

CAMP In December 2012, a severe winter storm toppled five steel poles supporting the same PG&E power lines minutes before the Camp Fire broke out.
Six years later, the 115,000-volt Caribou-Palermo power line was severed and destroyed for the second time in Pulga, 32 miles south of Paradise, California. This time, a rusty and rotten utility pole broke. translation:
Poland's ruling conservative government has moved to reinstate a Supreme Court judge who was forcibly removed from office following an injunction from the European Supreme Court.
The Law and Justice Party (PiS) submitted a relevant law on the Supreme Court to the president on Wednesday. According to Polish law, the bill will come into force after it is signed by President Andrzej Duda. The law is expected to apply to 27 forced retirements in the fall of 2017. The European Court of Justice has ruled that an attempt by PiS's main government to introduce early retirement in the Supreme Court amounted to a procedural irregularity. However, the European Commission ruled last week that the PiS government had violated EU ideals and had not made a serious attempt to reduce the politicization of Poland's highest court. PiS welcomed the court's ruling on Wednesday, with party parliamentary speaker Elzbieta Vitek tweeting: "Thank you for the victory." translation: DOVER, Del. (AP) - Ryan Blaney kept the party going long enough to boost business at his favorite bar after his first win of the season. He took the checkered flag in Charlotte and enjoyed the celebration. He even celebrated with a beer in Victory Lane after a win at Martinsville. He continued his celebration at a different kind of bar at Dover International Speedway, where the beer he and his remaining Cup drivers drank in May was served on tap. He went just 9-2 in the Coca-Cola 600 at DraftKings Sportsbook, but didn't reach for the bottle until the long bus ride back. NASCAR's rival Truck stopped to chat with many of the players in his series. Blaney said Monday that it took him a few hours to get used to victory lane, whether it was a Cup win or something else. input:
Security always comes down to securing applications.
The whole point of firewalls is to hide internally deployed network applicationsassumed to have exploitable vulnerabilities somewherefrom the outside world.
The main weakness of firewalls is that they are
continuation: focused on safety , which isnt precisely the same thing as a consumer experience : That is , how firewalls behave when it comes to performance and availability . So , firewall regulations are ( a ) hard to configure and manage and ( b ) for sure can negatively affect application availability and performance .Again , that doesnt mean all firewalls are bad . Just not as great as they could be .Then there are proxies . Proxies are programs that route and filter traffic between the Internet and private systems .And while theyre not new , proxies are growing increasingly essential to the enterprise . One of the most important reasons is that they enable secure entry to applications .So , as far as enhancing application quality and availability , proxies are essential . A good example of this is the Secure Web Gateway ( SWG ) .But truly , its all about the protection .
translation:
Security is always about protecting your applications.
The purpose of a firewall is to hide internal network applications that may have exploitable vulnerabilities from the outside world.
The main weakness of firewalls is that they focus on security, but this is not quite the same as the consumer experience, i.e. how the firewall performs in terms of performance and availability. Therefore, firewall rules can be (a) difficult to configure and manage, and (b) can negatively impact application availability and performance. Again, this doesn't mean all firewalls are bad. Not that great. There are also proxies. A proxy is a program that routes and filters traffic between the Internet and private systems. Proxies are not new, but they are becoming increasingly important to businesses. One of the most important reasons is to provide secure access to applications. Therefore, proxies are necessary from the point of view of improving the quality and availability of applications. A great example of this is the Secure Web Gateway (SWG). But in reality, it's all about protection.

translation: Erin Cordray is the director of the radiography program at Baltimore County Community College. What does a radiologist do? Radiography uses x-rays to create images of the tissues, organs, bones, and blood vessels that make up the human body. Radiologists must always follow proper protocols to minimize radiation exposure and ensure adequate image quality. As part of her responsibilities, Ms. Cordray is responsible for managing the clinical placement of radiography classes and referring children for radiography to her ARRT. She also offers her five-week summer training course where high school students can spend her week observing children taking X-rays and understanding what it's like to be a radiologist. We also cooperate in planning. Learn about Mr. Cordray's ideas for the radiography profession. I think I entered the world of radiography because of my background in mathematics and science. In a 2011 New Yorker profile, Peter Thiel, tech-philanthropist and billionaire, surmised that probably the

Like many Silicon Valley pioneers , Thiel has been predicting imminent suicide .In a recent chat , the PayPal co - founder told me , I hope Im wrong , but Im reasonably confident that the world is going to end in our lifetimesprobably not this decade , but soon , probably within 100 years . It is no surprise , then , that Thiel has undertaken longevity science , having invested heavily in studies into both rejuvenation and cryonics .Thiel told the
translation:
Extraordinarily wealthy and powerful people like Peter Thiel and Elon Musk want to live forever. But at what cost?

In a 2011 New Yorker article, technology philanthropist and billionaire Peter Thiel suggested that perhaps what matters is how much you respect and love others. It's very hard to imagine that the time you spend playing video games and watching pornography would distract you from having new experiences. But now he wants his head frozen on ice. Like many Silicon Valley pioneers, Thiel has predicted his own imminent suicide. In a recent conversation, the PayPal co-founder told me: "I hope I'm wrong, but I'm pretty sure the world is going to end in our lifetimes, maybe not in this decade, but very soon, maybe within 100 years." . It's not surprising, then, that Thiel has become involved in the science of longevity and has invested heavily in research into both rejuvenation and cryonics.

translation:
Now that the floodwaters have begun to recede, victims of Tropical Storm Harvey in Texas are facing another problem: eviction notices. Even worse, some people want to rent an apartment they can't live in.
Sheri Iroki, a strategic analyst with the Texas Low Income Housing Clearinghouse, has heard from many residents who are facing eviction and can't even get into the housing they're renting. Of course, if the apartment is completely submerged under water, the tenant cannot be evicted from the apartment, Iroki said. However, this is not a reason for the tenant to stop paying rent. If a flood occurs and you need to evacuate, Texas property law protects you. This includes properties located in flood zones or hurricane-prone areas. You can also refuse to pay rent if your home does not have heat, water, or electricity. For the next two months, President Donald Trump designated Houston a major disaster area, meaning the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) may provide assistance to those affected. input: BlackBerry Ltd. has signed a deal to acquire U.S. artificial intelligence and cybersecurity company Cylance for US$1.4 billion in cash. The Ontario-based company called Cylance a pioneer in applying artificial intelligence, algorithmic
continuation: science and machine learning to cybersecurity software , providing predictive and preventive security capabilities . It said Cylance ' s tech will complement its BlackBerry Spark platform , providing real - time protection intelligence to protect BlackBerry customers against a broad variety of internet attacks and securing applications running in the cloud , on the endpoint or in the information center .We intend Cylance to quickly deliver us advanced products that will assist us to tackle the huge market opportunity in front of us , John Chen , BlackBerry ' s executive chairman and CEO , said in a statement . Chen called Cylance the world ' s leading machine learning and artificial intelligence firm , helping to reduce the most pervasive and powerful cyber raids .BlackBerry announced in October that it would purchase California - based cybersecurity startup Radianse Inc . for US $ 219 million . The company is now pushing to turn around its core operations .

translation: There is a lot of confusion when it comes to cloud computing. To be exact? Who is this for? What can you do? One such organization, the Cloud Industry Forum (CIF), has created its own online education portal to help businesses explore cloud computing opportunities. The organization says its content will help companies from all sectors, from large to small businesses, better understand opportunities. Cloud computing provides. The portal says it educates subscribers about cloud computing and provides resources for businesses to analyze and plan their migration to the cloud. This organization collaborates with his CIF members to create content. The platform includes practical guides, white papers, checklists, tools, and recommendations that are easy to use and adapt to companies' modern business models. Initial areas of focus include cloud security, business case development, adoption and implementation, migration and interoperability. Cloud computing is complex, and we hope that the Cloud Industry Forum's online education portal will help companies of all sizes meet these challenges.

input:
How David Bowie helped my autistic son become himself.
When my son Benj was a small boy of 4 and 5 with virtually no original language and no ability or desire to play in conventional ways, he and I connected through music. I
continuation: d find him at his desk , poring over the contents of cassette cases Id brought home from the radio stations where I worked . Hed pick out the cassette he desired , and sit in his high chair listening to the tiny , crackly speakers that played my song .He knew the collection by heart ; at times hed even told me what to play next before I could find the case . He also knowing what to do when a song concluded .Without fail , after every tune hed clamber up onto my shoulder and reach up to pat the side of my face . I was not certain how to explain this to other families .I begun to reference it in passing , wanting to gauge the response of parents of other tiny students . I wanted to understand if Id ever felt comfortable mentioning it in the context of my own sons education .Most families didnt seem to getting it . Many I spoke to did not
translation:
How David Bowie helped his autistic son grow up to be himself.
When my son Benji was a little boy, he was 4 or he was 5, he spoke very little native language and was unable or unwilling to play in the traditional way, but he and I connected through music. I found him at his desk going through a box of tapes he had brought home from the radio station where I worked. He selected the tape he wanted and sat in his chair, listening to my song play through a small crackling speaker. He knew the collection by heart. Sometimes they would even tell me what to play next before I even found the case. He also knew what to do when the song was over. After every song, he made sure to climb onto my shoulder and pat his face. I didn't know how to explain this to other family members. I wanted to gauge the reactions of other young children's parents, so I started talking about it. I wanted to understand if I felt comfortable bringing this up in the context of my son's education. Most families didn't seem to understand this. Many of the people I talked to didn't.

input:
The most popular teething rings contain hormone-disrupting chemicals, a new study warns.
Endocrine-disrupting chemicals are banned from use in products for children.
However, no studies have ever tested plastic teethers for
continuation: the presence of substances that disrupt hormones , experts at Tel Aviv University said . The survey measured for 18 different phthalates in a range of popular teething toys .The results showed 14 had amounts that were either above or just below the highest limit set by requirements . Endocrine - disrupting compounds ( EDCs ) are present in a variety of common products , particularly teething toys .While research demonstrate that these toys can prevent babies from chewing on objects and toys , they may increase their danger of exposure to EDCs . The American Academy of Pediatrics ( AAP ) says babies should not be shown anything that might pose a choking danger , which includes toys with little parts that can fit into a babys mouth .In addition , the AAP recommends that teething toys should not have twists and be soft
translation:
The most popular pacifiers contain hormone-disrupting chemicals, a new study warns.
Endocrine disrupting chemicals are prohibited in children's products.
But experts at Tel Aviv University say plastic pacifiers have never been tested for hormone disruptors. The study measured levels of 18 phthalates in many popular pacifier toys. They found that in 14 of those cases, the number was either above or slightly below the limit set by the requirements. Endocrine disrupting compounds (EDCs) are found in many common foods, especially teething toys. Research shows that while these toys may prevent children from chewing objects and toys, they may increase the risk of EDC exposure. The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) says infants should not be exposed to anything that can pose a choking hazard, such as toys with small parts that can fit into the infant's mouth. Additionally, the AAP recommends that teething toys be free of swirls and be soft.

input: The Chancellor has taken to the TV studios once ahead of what was intended to be the UKs final week inside the European Union. He needed up commenting on reports in several of this mornings papers that the Cabinet was preparing to oust
continuation: him from his office in a plot being headed by the Foreign Secretary , Jeremy Hunt . Its the first time that a Government minister has been publicly implicated in the plot against a Prime Minister .Tory backbenchers have took note , and are lining up to speak to the press . Theyre aghast at the Cabinet leaks .He joins The Independents former Westminster correspondent Heather Stewart , alongside Telegraph Chief Political Correspondent Christopher Hope , Channel 4s Political Editor Gary Gibbon and Financial Times Columnist Anatole Kaletsky , for a fascinating political roundtable . The rogue trader in a non - licensed brokerage firm will be charged with computer and telecommunication offences in Finland and Sweden .
translation: The prime minister visited a television studio ahead of what was expected to be Britain's last week in the European Union. He was forced to comment on reports in several morning newspapers that the Cabinet Office was preparing to sack him as part of a conspiracy led by Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt. This is the first time that a government minister has been publicly accused of being involved in a conspiracy against the prime minister. Conservative members have taken notice and are lining up to speak to the press. They are stunned to see a leak from the cabinet. He joins former Independent Westminster correspondent Heather Stewart, Telegraph chief political correspondent Christopher Hope, Channel 4 political editor Gary Gibbon and Financial Times columnist Anatole Kalecki in an interesting political roundtable. To do. Fraudsters operating unlicensed securities companies will face computer and telecommunications crime charges in Finland and Sweden.

translation:
This is the latest in Adam Curtis's essay series, "All Under the Watch of the Machines of Loving Grace," which you can view for free here. I've written about the series previously here and here.

One of Curtis's many sources is Nafees Ahmed. And Curtis is one of Ahmed's biggest fans: Ahmed has written about him: Adam Curtis, who recently completed the BBC2 documentary series "All Watched Over by the Machines of Loving Grace," tells the story of how Nafees Ahmed warned him about a great clash of hidden logic surrounding the terrorism scam. (Nafees Ahmed's essay here is one of the longest on Ahmed's site, and is interesting in this respect; it's more of a defense of the Prophet Daniel than a defense of Curtis, but it does explain Curtis's work in a really surprising way.) In the YouTube interview posted at the beginning of the series about Ahmed Curtis, he comes off as more of a man with rabbit ears than the intimidating figure he claims to be.

They put their trust in our experts .They rest easy that their communities will continue to

Hospitals are diligently developing strategies to expand their diagnostic capabilities while meeting strict cost containment criteria. Even the for-profit hospital's financial difficulties are reflected in the holding company's quarterly financial reports, and it has never had trouble getting investors to fund it. However, most of our time is spent with patients and parents. and our professional colleagues. This is where real value is created, whether measured in the income statement or not. We must remind ourselves that there is a huge humanity at the heart of health care, and that we benefit from hospitals that care deeply about the people they serve. An operation in a specialised unit at Oldham General Hospital removed eggs from Louises mother , Jean Brown , and fertilised them with sperm from her husband John .The resulting embryo was then moved to her mothers uterus , where it implanted and her mums life as a mother had begun . translation:
Leslie and John Brown with their daughter Louise, the world's first test tube baby.
It is ironic that the parents of Louise Brown, the world's first test tube baby, are not eligible for IVF treatment in Scotland today. The operation, carried out in a specialist department at Oldham General Hospital, removed Louise's eggs from her mother Jean Brown and fertilized them with her husband John's sperm. Can Grizzlies get city's trust back like Memphis basketball, football?
Memphis football and basketball have regained the city's trust. Can Grizzlies do the same?
Memphis athletic director Tom Bowen stood along the sideline at Liberty Bowl Memorial Stadium taking in
continuation: the scene with an anxious look . The Memphis football team was trailing Houston by 18 points in the third quarter .A goal line stand was up next . If the Grizzlies had failed to make the NCAA finals , what would he have to say to Memphis supporters who expected more ?How could he understand such a year ? The next year , when the Tigers were setting to make their first trip to the Cotton Bowl Classic , Bowen was on the field inside the locker hall in Dallas with a microphone in front of him .He was joined by Memphis football coach Mike Norvell , and he faced reporters who sought to see if his statement in 2016 was sincere . input: Amid all the handwringing over the cast exodus at SNL is the minor detail of how much, even with the ensemble at so-called full strength, the jokes land like water dripping from a faucet.
continuation: Only in an alternate universe does SNL with its weekly average of fewer than eight laughs per episode , in my estimation have any right to exist . With 34 decades on the air and a multi - platform reach , the program looks to exist in a Nielsen bubble , proving yet again that audiences voting with their remotes .Cast and crew members can always find solace in knowing that the program SNL has produced a legacy of material to one day be picked apart by discerning fans . Consider the 1997 - 98 season .The weekly average of laughs that year was the lowest I have ever recorded and the lowest it has ever been since . The season was legendary .Two of its episodes Animal House and JFK were listed among the 20 best - ever . If we were to compile a list of SNL classics from 1
translation:
Amidst all the excitement over the exodus of the cast from SNL, there's a small detail. Even when the ensemble is a so-called full cast, the jokes flow like water from a faucet.
In my opinion, only in another world would SNL have the right to exist with an average of less than 8 laughs per episode per week. The show, which has been on the air for 34 years and spans multiple platforms, seems to exist within Nielsen's bubble, proving once again that viewers are voting with their remotes. The cast and crew can always take comfort in knowing that the SNL show has created a legacy of material that will one day be dismantled by discerning fans. Let's look at the 1997-98 season. The average number of laughs per week this year was the lowest I've ever recorded and the lowest ever. This season was legendary. Two of his episodes, "Animal House" and "JFK," rank in the top 20 of all time. I made a list of SNL masterpieces from scratch.

It's been a hellish year for music. Rick Parfitt died the day before (December 24). So many legends have passed away this year  from David Bowie to Prince to Leonard Cohen to Glenn Frey.
When I was in school,
continuation: we had this assignment . In the upper - year sociology class , I had to pick a rock star from one of the rock ' n ' roll icons of the late twentieth century .My first choice was Jimi Hendrix . I penned an essay , detailing how he was a cultural icon because his guitar solos were so intricate that they were virtually unfathomable .But he gave us a glimpse of his talent by recording them in small fragments . Jimi Hendrix wasn ' t your typical rock star .He performed in a recording studio in New York for less than a year in 1966 , and death immediately after in a London hotel room . He revolutionized guitar recording .I still have my article , and that ' s not a joke the paper was done in crayon , so it looks like it was scribbled on a roads billboard . I used to think that composing my
translation:
It's been an incredible year for music. Rick Parfitt passed away yesterday (December 24th). So many legends have passed away this year, from David Bowie to Prince to Leonard Cohen to Glenn Frey.
When I was in school, we were given such an assignment. In our final sociology class, we had to choose a rock star from among the rock and roll icons of the late 20th century. My first choice was Jimi Hendrix. His guitar solos are so complex and almost incomprehensible that I wrote a detailed essay about how he was a cultural icon. But by recording them in small fragments, he gave us a glimpse of his talent. Jimi Hendrix was not your typical rock star. He performed in a New York recording studio for less than a year in 1966, and died soon after in a London hotel room. He revolutionized guitar recording. I still have my article, but I'm not kidding. The paper was written in crayon, so it looks like it was scribbled on a road sign. I thought the essay was mine.

input: Asked where they had their most memorable campus experiences, Dartmouth students polled back when I was an undergraduate most frequently identified the Hopkins Center for the Arts. It is certainly the site I would have identified if asked. I still recall, to take just one example
continuation: , the incredible complexity of the architecture ; so several buildings , and so much excellent lighting , from the wooden support pillars beneath the seating of the Kroll Performance Hall to the bookstalls inside the Hanover Malls walkway . With its magnificent acoustics , generous seating , and strong seamless design design , it sits as one of the triumphs of Dartmouths built landscape .Dartmouths memorable alumni represent all seven Arts and Sciences colleges .
translation: When I asked them what their most memorable campus location was, Dartmouth students told me that the name they mentioned most often when I was an undergraduate was the Hopkins Center for the Arts. If you ask me, I will definitely say the name of this place. For example, I still remember the incredible complexity of the architecture. From the wooden supports under the seats in the Crawl Performance Hall to the bookstores in the sidewalks of Hanover Mall, the many buildings and beautiful lighting make an impression. With great acoustics, ample seating, and a striking, cohesive design, this hotel is one of Dartmouth's scenic triumphs. Dartmouth College's memorable alumni represent all seven Colleges of Arts and Sciences.

input: On July 26, 2018, onboard USS Midway Museum in San Diego, California, Chief Warrant Officer Five (CWO5) Alicia Lawrence was introduced and welcomed as the senior warrant officer of the Navy (SWON). She assumed the prestigious title and
continuation: role of SWON from CWO5 David Westrick who served in that position since 2012 . CWO5 Westrick sat as SWON during a period of transformation and transition for the Chief Warrant Officer Community and will be retiring from active duty on 31 July 2018 .CWO5 Westrick took the SWON name as a re - activation of the office and position . CWO5 Lawrence , a 31 - month Navy veteran , was born in Boston and is a alumnus of Massachusetts Institute of Technology ( MIT ) with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering .Her debut assignment was to U . S . Naval Ship Repair Facility & Japan Regional Maintenance Center ( SRF & JRMC ) in Yokosuka , Japan , where she served as a Warrant Officer Second Class (
translation: On July 26, 2018, Warrant Officer Five (CWO5) Alicia Lawrence was introduced and accepted as Chief Warrant Officer (SWON) at the USS Midway Museum in San Diego, California. She takes over the prestigious title and role of SWON from CWO5 David Westrick, who has held the position since 2012. CWO5 Westrick will retire from active duty on July 31, 2018, having served as his SWON during a period of change and transition for the Chief Warrant Officer community. CWO5 Westrick has acquired her SWON name as a revitalization of the office and position. CWO5 Lawrence is a Navy veteran who served 31 months, was born in Boston, and graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) with a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. Her debut assignment was in the United States. She served as a Warrant Officer 2nd Class at the Naval Ship Repair Facility and Japan Regional Maintenance Center (SRF and JRMC) in Yokosuka, Japan.

translation:
Dinshaw Bilimorya and Sulochana from Ardeshir Iranis Kir Ranjha, photographed in 1929. Photo: Courtesy of Donabelle Garga.
India may be celebrating its 100th anniversary of cinema this year, but India's first sound film, Heer Ranjha (1929), remains shrouded in mystery. Although no footage or even stills of the film exist, it won an honorable mention at the Venice Film Festival and helped propel the careers of Devika Rani and Noorjehan. The legacy of this seminal work of Ardeshir Irani is elusive, and so is the mystery surrounding Heer Ranjha. Over the past 90 years, it has expanded rather than retreated. It was India's first talkie film and the first to make it to Italy. No one remembers him, but he paved the way for today's Bollywood, says Donabelle Garga, who runs Studio Garga, a production company in Mumbai. Initially, it was reported in Indian Film Weekly that Heer Ranjha is one of the best films ever made.

translation: The majority of 45 Amazon.com customers who reviewed Bloomberg Businessweek writer Brad Stone's new book, The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon, gave it five stars. Ta. But only one of them is a prolific but decidedly negative critic named K. McGlothen. Since July 2011, McGlothen has been giving bad reviews to 15 novels a week, most of them business and financial nonfiction. (Click here if you want to know what all the fuss is about.) We reached out to his Stone and his Amazon. We are accepting comments, but have not yet received a response. Of course, Amazon reader reviews have never been the most accurate guide to quality. Some critics, even for non-fiction, simply repeat the PR of a publisher or author. But that's a good thing, right? This does not mean that authors were more honest when Amazon did not create reviews. Stone's book chronicles Amazon's rise from an upstart online bookseller to the world's largest company.

translation:
Washington Republican David Yancey won the toss and broke a tie in the controversial 94th District election in Newport News on Thursday, but his opponent contested the decision and likely called for a recount. expected to be sought.
Control of the House of Representatives hangs in the balance with Democrats, who are just one seat away from weakening Republican control of the House. Democratic Representative Rocky Holcomb of the 94th District released the following statement: There is no doubt that the 94th Ward won. Procedural failures, intimidation at polling places, and voter suppression clearly tilted the election in favor of the opposition. The best way for Virginia to be ruled by politicians would be to elect Virginians, fix the election in the 94th District, and pick a winner.
